Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel, close enough to many major attractions, but away from the sirens for a peaceful nights rest. Yes you can walk about rome with the glint of adventure and discovery in your eye, and trust me EVERY day you will find more, but after 3 days (as i found out) catching the buses about really helps. Soooo cheap too. Fantastic staff. Reception (blonde lady and joe, porters and wait staff at breakfast) even when busy managed really well. We had routes highlighted each day from reception on a map, bookings made for us in advance for the trip to the Vatican, breakfast food was great, the choice of pastry, fruit, bacon and eggs, bread, meat and cheese, juice, coffee, cereal and more. It really was a great variety. The room was comfortable and clean with a safe and fridge (buy a bottle to keep chilled) the shower was powerful and over all 9/10 it only misses the last point beacuse we would have loved to see the Da Vinci code or other related movies in bed, but really who goes away to watch tv??? So to conclude...I would totally recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: tammy k
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. First of all this hotel was the one of the worst places I have ever stayed at. I know its not a JW Marriott but seriously who ever rated this as a 4 star was drinking to much Vino. The first night we checked it our room was not ready as it was spose to be ready at 2:00. After traveling all night from the US I just wanted to check in and get ourselves together to start our vacation. Room wasnt ready until 3:45 at least they did comp a bottle of wine. The toilet ran for like 15 min after flushing. When you open the door to enter the room it hit the bed. Air did not work or the fan. We were told that there was a city ordenance and they couldnt turn it on but at least the fan should of worked. We ask to change rooms due to it being so noisy. So they moved us up a floor but was so lucky to be next to the elevator lift. Room bigger but still noisy. There is no bar,gym or restaurant. They do serve breakfast but you can count on waiting to get a table ( i think there was like 10 in there) and they served the same thing each morning. The coffee machine was a joke! 1 lift for the entire hotel and it was extremely slow. I timed it one time it took 3.5 min for the elevator to make it from the 3rd floor to the main lobby. Last but not least this hotel is not in a central location if you are wanting to hit the main sites. I really wished I took the time to read reviews before booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ICorper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in an economy room, the staff were excellent and can't be faulted for their attentiveness and helpfulness. Having an early flight we arrived at the hotel around 11 AM, check-in is from 2 PM so we took advantage of their luggage room so we didn't waste any time seeing the city. When we got back to the hotel at about 5 PM our room was prepared and our bags already up there. Also on the day we were leaving they kept our bags from the time we checked out (~10:30) to when we needed to go for the train (~16:00). Breakfast is excellent with a wide choice available, I would recommend it completely. Having eaten breakfast we found we didn't need more than a snack at lunch time to keep us going to the evening. The economy room we stayed in was at the back on the third floor, not much of a view (but then it was an economy room) but the room was spacious, nice shower room with toilet and bidet. The bed was also very comfortable and more than enough storage space (3 wardrobes and several drawers), also a safe in the room. TV showing a variety of channels is several languages. Nice restaurants nearby too. We found the hotel to be well situated, only about 200m from a bus route (62) that goes direct to the Vatican, most of the other sites you want to see are within walking distance, and only about 1km from the Roma Termini, Leonardo Express is a direct train from there to there to the airport. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Luvlycaroline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located about a fifteen walk downhill to the Spanish Steps and is in a lovely safe area. The room was very comfortable, clean and very well maintained The breakfast was really good with lots of fresh fruit, pastries, hot food & cereals etc. and there is a Pizzeria right across the road which had gorgeous home made pastas. The greatest asset to the hotel was the staff. They were so helpful, friendly and approachable and were always willing to go the extra mile to be of help. We stayed Easter Weekend which of course is a very busy time in Rome, and we felt that the staff were always willing to make time for us. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent long weekend”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteWolverhanpton
Reviews.Content: As four friends we enjoyed a five night stay at the Gambrinus Hotel, which is in a good location. The staff spoke fluent English were friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms were excellent with comfy beds and spacious modern bathrooms. Buffet breakfast offered a wide choice. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: justanothergemini
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Gambrinus. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is on the edge of town, near the train station, but in an overall good location. We were able to walk to the North Rome, Vatican City, Pantheon Neighborhood and Trastevere areas. The Metro/Transit is easily accessible from the hotel and we utilized the subway and bus to see Ancient Rome. Our room was clean, very comfortable and quiet. (We were never able to hear people in the adjacent rooms) The buffet style breakfast was amazing. They offered many options and everything served was fresh. The only inconvenience (if it can really be called one) is that the elevator was slow, so we often opted to just take the stairs. We recommend The Gambrinus when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rhysw83
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel with friendly staff, good location, we walked everywhere apart from the Vatican. Only minor worries were the breakfast which was a little disappointing and the fact that we had an adjoining room so could hear everything next door. Good job there were an elderly couple! Would still stay again despite the small niggles.

Reviews.Title: “No privacy”
Reviews.Author: Laura E
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, not a very centric zone but well conected by bus. The worst thing of all is that you can listen your neighbours flushing the toilet, talking, sneezing or whatever they do. So think before booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clay L
Reviews.Content: Gambrinus Hotel had very helpful staff, beautiful rooms (loved the wallpaper), extremely comfortable beds (the comforter was amazing!) and the best continental breakfast we had on our trip, by far. I'd absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and greeting”
Reviews.Author: Darren and Juli... P
Reviews.Content: All of the staff at The Gambrinus were very informative and helpful thoughout our stay. The young lady at reception was particulary helpful giving us advise and guidance during our first trip to the city. The choice at breakfast was excellent and all of the staff that we encounted were a credit to the hotel. We would recommend the hotel to others and we are already looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Experience extremely satisfactory - Rome has been a pleasure from the Gambrinus. Perfect spot.”
Reviews.Author: marysnow_ie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying in the Gambrinus Hotel for 5 days/4 nights in march 2012.We paid 332 euro for the staying, which was a perfect price for a 4 stars in Rome. To recap our staying here: - location is excellent; - rooms very well kept and perfectly clean (a must in my eyes); - the staff extremely professional, but helpful and friendly; - breakfast more than satisfactory; 6 minutes walking from the Termini station (do not trust google map and get instead Via Goito from Piazza dell'Indipendenza: it is not only shorter, but nicer to do). We walked from there to the main attactions in the city center (Piazza di Spagna,Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, etc.). Get the Roma Pass card and you will have 2 museums/attractions and all transportation included for 3 days (worthed, albeit this does not include the Vatican museums) We loved our staying here and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: moby48
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel made special by its excellent staff. From the front desk to the bar to the breakfast room - all were extremely helpful. We enjoyed a very nice breakfast buffet and had fun at the bar. We had some wonderful restaurant recommendations from the front desk, who happily made reservations for us and then directed us to each destination.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: bruz97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. It was part of a tour package that we purchased from go-today.com. The service at this hotel was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh; the waiter staff was very eager to please. Our room was in the front of the hotel but the street noise did not bother us. The beds were comfortable. My only complaint would be that the bathroom was very small and the size of the shower made it almost impossible to shower. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to some of the attractions. There is a great pizzeria across the street from the hotel which I would recommend. It's not expensive and it serves the best pizza in Rome. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lasagnelover
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Rome staying at the Gambrinus Hotel. The Hotel is very nice, our room was quite small but adequate as we didn't spend much time in it. The decor in the room was very tasteful and the furniture was in keeping with the decor, the bed was very comfortable and there was a large television. There were also tea and coffee making facilities, but unfortunately no milk!!. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and as the hotel is fairly central we were able to cover much of the city on foot although there are plenty of buses which go past the hotel. We were given a map as we arrived and this helped us to find our way around. We would thorughly recommend this hotel to anyone and should we visit Rome again would most certainly stay there. There is a very nice Pizzaria just opposite the hotel which serves very good pizza and pasta meals at very reasonable prices compared to some other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Izabela F
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel situated in central Rome, easy access to all attractions. Very attentive and helpfull staff, especially Dario. He went out of his way to point out all the attractions, routes, recommended restaurants, couldn't praise him enough. Theroom was clean and comfortable. Great breakfast, free wifi, execellent value for money. Already recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davidlowe46
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff, comfortable rooms, great breakfast and free wifi all at a reasonable price. Also very handy for centre of rome, easy access to the Mtero and lots of buses go past the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Colin M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a group of six. We were welcomed by staff who recommended a lovely restaurant within walking distance. The Gambrinus was very central and we found our way around Rome with the help of the map given to us on arrival. The staff could not do enough for us and our stay was a pleasure. The breakfast set us up for the sightseeing days ahead. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and should we return to Rome, will not hesitate to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda40_55
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay at end of February. Very well located hotel, within 10/15 minutes walk to railway terminal. Extremely helpful and friendly staff who provided lots of useful local information with a map marked with all the sights/bus routes etc. Even provided us with a wonderful guide book which proved very useful! Lovely room/en-suite and great breakfast with lots of choice. Many thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hannah B
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay in the Gambrinus Hotel in Rome and I would recommend it to anyone. There are no faults I can think of at all, it was literally a perfect stay! On arrival we were warmly welcomed by a lovely member of staff (unfortunately I didn't catch his name). Once we had given our details he gave us a map of the city and lots of useful advice on how to get around. As we'd arrived before check in we were directed to their guest lounge and bathrooms and invited to take all the time we needed to freshen up. The hotel is in a great location and we found it no problem at all to walk to nearly all the sights we wanted to see. One or two that were further away were easily got to by us or metro - both of which are close to the hotel. The room was fantastic - very clean, warm and with all amenities you'd want. I was particularly impressed by the clean bathroom as this is rarely the case even in 5 star hotels! I'd also like to give a special mention to Roberta, a member of staff on thr front desk who was a fantastic help and a wonderful lady to chat to - always helpful, smiling and showed a great passion for her hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “G H Great Hotel, excellent location, away from traffic but close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine042
Reviews.Content: We had a four night break here in February 2012. It is the perfect base for exploring the city. I would advise taking a bus to Terminus from the airport, thus saving a lot of money and either walk to Gambrinus or take the bus from the Terminus grounds. Our return bus transfer was approx 16 euro for two, much less than a train or taxi and an interesting drive. The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Terminus and with a bus outside the door who could ask for anything more? The staff here were excellent and any request was attended to at once. Great knowledge of all sites and map of central Rome given on arrival, discussed with us and key locations highlighted. Pocket sized Guide book given at breakfast identifying churches, museums, routes and maps. Pleasant rooms, not overly large but clean. classy and comfortable. The bar was stocked for a night cap not a session. Breakfast was excellent, with plenty of variety and the room layout allowed for a lot of movement. Friendly hard working staff on duty. I don't want to walk past endless shops when I get out the door of a hotel or I may be in danger of not getting any where. There are some beautiful shops close by, before you go sight seeing or on your return, so don't feel cheated. In the vicinity of the hotel there are many small restaurants and bars which the staff will direct you to. It is a short walk from Gambrinus to the many must see sites, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, Piazza Navona, Pantheon. It is close to Metro link but our visit to the Vatican was the only time we required to use the Metro. Would receommend it as an excellent hotel when visiting Rome and would stay again if I was back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, helpful staff, wonderful city break”
Reviews.Author: Purplesquirrel7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay in Rome with friends and the Gambrinus was the perfect base. On the 1st night after arriving late, Roberta made dinner reservations at a local restaurant (the food was excellent), and another member of staff escorted us from the hotel to the door! The attention to detail could not have not been better; every single person went out of their way to ensure that our stay was comfortable. The rooms were very clean and well presented with complimentary water and wifi. There was a wide selection of food at breakfast and the waiter was so pleasant and helpful. We were given a map on arrival which was invaluable, all of the bus routes and major attractions were highlighted and all were within walking distance if you prefer to wander and explore the city. We would highly recommend the Angels & Demons tour. There are lots of very good bars & restaurants in the area around the hotel. Would highly recommend the Gambrinus and will stay again on returning to Rome - this is a city that you have to revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLafferty
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Gambrinus, good location. 10 minute walk to the Termini and 20 minutes in the another direction to trevi fountain and spanish steps. The female receptionist was really helpful and welcoming - I found the two male receptionists a little cool and aloof in contrast. Ruel had breakfast in order each day and clearly loves his job, just the friendly face you need in the morning. We stayed in a contemporary room in the block next door. Didn't mind being next door, the room looked good and the double glazing kept any traffic noise out really well. Would return if in Rome again and some of the staff are worth their weight in gold.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: AMK84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gambrinus for a 2 night break in March and would happily recommend it to friends and family. The hotel itself is a 10 minute walk from Termini station and about 5 minutes from Republica metro station. Near numerous bus routes and 20 mins walk from Trevi Fountain, the Gambrinus is in a very central location. We got a great deal on our stay via lastminute.com but what really set this hotel apart was the friendliness of the staff and their determination that we enjoy our stay. From our fantastic welcome by the staff at reception, followed by assistance with the safe in our room, right through to breakfast on both mornings, the staff did everything they could to make our stay a pleasure. We received an upgrade upon arrival and had a superior room - very clean, plenty of room for our requirements and a good sized bathroom with a good shower. The breakfast on offer had plenty of variety and was very tasty. For those looking for a good value base for a break in Rome, I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 10 minute walk from the Termini Station and easy to find providing you arm yourself with a map. A good impression is gained as soon as you step into the small foyer and a warm welcome awaits from the friendly staff. One of our reasons for choosing the hotel was the prospect of a good breakfast and the Gambrinus doesn't disappoint. A wonderful choice of hot and cold self-service food is available with a cheerful waiter on hand. The rooms have an interesting decor and are clean. We had a room on the second floor at the front of the hotel and slept well even with the window open. Noise from the street was minimal. The pizzeria opposite was so good we returned a second time. All in all a wonderful 4 night stay and very good value. Late February was a good time to visit with daytime temperatures between 15 and 19 degrees and short queues for the major attractions. A 'Rome Pass' gave us 3 days unlimited travel on bus and metro plus 2 museum entrances, although we did end up clocking up several miles on foot. This is not a problem in Rome because there is so much to see. So much in Rome is inspiring and the City is unequalled anywhere in the world. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sheenarocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel in february 2012. The staff were ever so friendly and our room was really clean and the bathroom modern. The receptionist staff told us it was walking distance to all of "modern" Rome but that we needed to take the bus to the Vatican and ancient Rome. This would be true if you are not a very active walker. However, we walked to ancient Rome and it took us 30-40 minutes and that is easy distance especially when there's plenty to see on the way. The Vatican however is a bus journey away and takes about 15 minutes. The hotel breakfast was also really good with plenty of fresh fruit, several types of bread and ham and cheese to go with it. The fact that we were so pleased with our hotel helped this in making our trip to Rome one of our best holidays so far.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights. The location is perfect for all the main attractions in Rome. The staff were very helpful and hotel was amazing for the price. I would definitely stay there again. I would happily recommend it!.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: rdh_1_kar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps, which my daughter and I never did find-lol. It is in a wonderfule neighborhood, very close to multiple bus stops, ten minutes from Termini station, many food options, shopping and even an electronics store. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean, and all of the employees are friendly and helpful. Giuseppe who works nights at the front desk was especially helpful, and Ruel downstairs in the breakfast room greeted us every morning with a big smile and a great attitude. I think the empoyees make this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: IreneFraser
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews when choosing the hotel for our city break in Rome and most of them said very good things about this hotel, and they were true! Very nice, clean hotel, in the centre of the city, from where you can walk everywhere (we love walking), with nice restaurants and shops around it. The staff must be highlighted in the review as they made our stay incredible pleasant. Breakfast was lovely as well, with plenty of fresh fruit and cakes!! Also all the savoury options you might wish for, very happy about it. Overall, I will recommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gambrinus - Good Hotel, Good Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JPR_101
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a 3 night city break in Rome where we stayed at the Gambrinus Hotel. The staff on reception were very helpful (Roberta & Victoria[??]) were the names I think I remember! Room was small - but it was a budget double - so we didnt expect a palatial suite. Room was clean, bathroom was spotless and the towels were changed every day - quite a pleasant suprise. If we were staying longer then I would have thought long and hard about upgrading to a larger room - but for a short stay it was fine. The breakfast that was included in the already cheap price was great. All you could wish for: from fruit and cereal to a 'full English' with everything inbetween. Great way to set you up for the day and the breakfast staff were polite, cheerful and helpful too. Free [fast] internet meant we could keep up with the family back home and research for the next days adventures too. All in all - more than we expected for the price and would happily come back and stay at this hotel again. As others have said - good clean and safe location: easy access to to the main station 'Termini' or very close to bus connections to all parts of Rome - we caught buses to the Vatican, Pantheon, Forum and Collessium from 'just around the corner' ... Oh and the restaurant directly across from the hotel was nice too! -

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus for 2 weeks in February 2012 and used it as a base of operations for our visit to Rome, Florence, Assisi, Pompei, and Amalfi. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Their advice and assistance was first rate and smoothed many details we did not have to worry about. The buffet breakfast (and bags of food to sustain you on various trips) was delightful and a fabulous start to the day. The lobby lounge was small but perfect as a place to relax and enjoy chance conversations with other guests. Their recommendations for dinner were great and virtually all their suggestions turned into places we went to again and again. The room was small but quiet and clean with a very high ceiling and a big window so it felt spacious. Definitely a fine place to stay when visiting the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Rome very much and Gambrinus Hotel provided us with a very lovely accommodation. Staff was very friendly, especially receptionist Victoria. She gave us plenty of useful tips of what to visit and where to eat. Our room was very cute, very clean and spacious. The breakfast was very good with a varied menu. One morning I had a chocolate cake and my boyfriend was able to enjoy both hot cooked and continental breakfast. The location was good, most of the famous places were within walking distance. If we were to visit Rome again, we would stay here and if friends of ours were taking a trip to Rome we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: hugh_forsyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in February. We were given a warm and helpful welcome, and all the staff we encountered spoke good English and were very friendly, going out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The room was on the small side but perfectly adequate: plenty of hot water and everything worked. The location is good for arriving/departing, being 10 minutes walk from Termini, where the airport shuttle bus terminates, and also good for sightseeing. Breakfast was good and the hotel staff recommended very pleasant restaurants locally.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: VascoFT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Gambrinus, having spent there 4 nights. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. All staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was a bit small, but we got a very good promotion price, so it was a very good value for money. The window should isolate better the outside noise, but during the night the street is very calm, and also not so busy during the day. The bed was very very comfortable! Breakfast was included and was very complete. Its location is about 10min walk from Termini and other 10-15min from Piazza Spagna. Very nice neighborhood, calm, apparently safe, with several restaurants with different price scales. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but needs to be more customer focused”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: The prebooked taxi did not arrive at the airport so I had to phone several times. The hotel and taxi were prepaid online but I found at check-in that they didn't process the payment. This meant paying with cash rather than credit card. The hotel advertises having room service but in fact only provides an expensive minibar. The room was a little small but well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast was very nice. The dining room did not cater for other meals. The hotel is in a convenient location and the staff were very efficient. One of the staff (Roberta) spoke several languages and was very friendly and made the stay much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst either.”
Reviews.Author: pimpemo
Reviews.Content: When we checked in all we were given was a map with the hotels location. Nothing about close attractions or restaurants which it seemed everyone else was given upon check in. This wasn’t really a problem for us as we had done our research and knew where everything was in advance, it just would have been nice. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are small but it didn’t bother us. The rooms were a bit outdated and a few of the things were broken in our room. The toilet seat was wonky so whenever it was sat on it slid to one side and the shaving mirror had broken completely that it wouldn’t stay in an upright position. The shower leaked a little but there were enough towels that this wasn’t a major issue. The toilet door also didn’t shut properly and didn’t even have a lock. We were there for the sights, not the room. It was cosy enough that it was lovely to return to after a long days walking. The hotel is in a good location. It is a bit far out but we walked everywhere and found that wherever we walked it was beautiful which made the walking a lot more enjoyable. It is about 10/15 minutes from the Termini, 25 minutes away from the Trevi Fountain and about 40 minutes away from the Colosseum. There are also a lot of restaurants around. We only visited a few and they were all good. There is a tabacchi across the street where you can buy a travel pass although we didn’t do this. Down the road from the hotel is a lovely little shop called MiaCasa. It is more of a homewares shop but they do ornaments of some of the major attractions in Rome which are a million times better quality than the ones you can buy off street sellers and in the souvenir shops. They were a lot bigger and have a lot more detail so if you are after something like this it would be worth going there for it. The hotel staff were overall very helpful and friendly. We found the female staff to be more friendly and more helpful. They helped with booking tickets, making reservations for restaurants and printing our boarding passes for our flight back. One tip we would give is don’t use the tour guide they use; Green Line Tours. We booked one and were gutted with what we got. We paid €59 each for a tour of the Vatican that lasted about an hour and a half and to cut costs they did the tour in both English and Spanish. This got really annoying as you had to keep stopping whilst she said the same thing in Spanish and got a little boring when it was something long that was being said. The tour could have been a lot better and we could have seen more had they just done it in English. We also had to sit on the coach for about 15 minutes whilst we waited for the tour guide to come out. Breakfast at the hotel for me was terrible. The cooked food was very salty which made it inedible to me. A lot of other people seemed to enjoy it so it is more a matter of personal taste. There was a huge selection to choose from ranging from cereal, bread, cakes, cooked meats, cheese, cereal, pastries, bacon, sausage and egg. It would have been better if there was more selection of hot foods to choose from. The pastries are also coated in sugar making them very sweet. It would probably be worth looking for somewhere else for breakfast. They also have two drinks machines which do all sorts of drinks ranging from hot chocolate to coffee, although the sugar in the hot chocolate settled at the bottom and took a lot of stirring to get rid of it. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would say the hotel is more of a 3 star establishment than 4 star. We went to Rome to see the sights so the room wasn’t too bad, just a place to sleep really. If we were to return to Rome we would probably go with a different hotel although wouldn’t turn this one down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: wharky
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. Very helpful staff. Rooms a tad tight but clean and well presented nonetheless. Breakfast was very good and set us up for the long days sightseeing in the snow!!! Would recommend this hotel to friends and if and when we're back in rome it would be our first choice

Reviews.Title: “Roaming in Rome”
Reviews.Author: harveybirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gambrinus hotel on 14 - 18 February having read other reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. We found the hotel easily (having purchased shuttle bus tickets on the flight to Termini Station and with a 10 minute walk) and had a warm welcome. The room was gorgeous, cosy and decorated beautifully, we had tea making fascilities, toilettries, iron and hair dryer - all helpful when taking hand lugguage only. We walked to all of the main attractions (Colusseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and numerous Bascillica's) and caught the 62 bus to the Vatican or you can catch the metro - just 2 stops. We ate a hearty breakfast daily - fresh fruit salad, cerals, breads, cheeses, cold meats, cooked breakfasts AND desert!! Fabulous chocolate mousse, cakes, fresh fruit flans, yummy! There is a bar too. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel as there is so much to see and do (recommend the tour guides outside the Vatican - we paid E40 and had an amazing tour guide, jumped the queues, learned so much - well worth it) I recommend a sturdy pair of shoes - we walked our feet off, but slept well as the room was quiet and the bed comfortable, we would recommend this hotel and thank them for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: skippaUk
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service form the staff, who were friendly, helpful, polite and knowledgeable. They booked restaurants for us, arranged taxis and were a credit to the hotel. Especially Victoria - nothing was too much trouble for her and her advice was always straight to the point and accurate... great all-round service. Breakfast was substantial with hot and cold foods available and a good selection. Only downside - it was busy at breakfast and if you arrived at the 'wrong time' - you had to wait for a table to be cleared... maybe a reflection on the choice available... Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: DJWales
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in the Gambrinus Hotel in Rome,Italy, the hotel was advertised as a 4* however I would say that in UK standards that it was probably a 3*, we picked this hotel as it had very good reviews and it was close to the city centre, although the room was small (room 105) it was adequate, as previous reviews had commented the hotel is next to the French Embassy so security is not a problem and we never felt uneasy walking the streets, the staff in the hotel are very helpful and an excellent breakfast is served. so if you are looking for reasonably priced city centre hotel then the Gambrinus is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: john n
Reviews.Content: we stayed last week at the Gambrinus and it was PERFECT , all the staff is very helpful ,the room was small looking over the villa bonaparte garden it was clean and nice decorated an with all ammenaties including free wifi , coffe maker and 2 bottles of water for free , itwas at walking distance to main attractions , just in front of the hotel you can get the bet pizza in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: legend187
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between the 5th and 8th of February, just after the snowfall. The hotel is set in a very quiet area, a 10 minute walk from the Termini. The reception was impressive with marble floors and walls, with friendly reception staff. We stayed in room 104, which was a small room with very little space to move around. However, it was very clean and had everything needed of a base, comfort and warmth. There is a small bar in the hotel, although this is unstaffed unless you wish to order something but it is quite pricey and consists of a few bottles on a shelf. The breakfast, between 7am-10am, had a wide selection. The cooked food of bacon, sausages and scrambled egg was fairly cold so I avoided this and went with the big selection fruit, pastries, yoghurts and cakes. All sites can be walked to from the hotel, we spent three days walking and this hotel was always a pleasant place to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in the Snow”
Reviews.Author: balds0
Reviews.Content: We arrived just as the snow started to fall and it stayed all weekend- which wasa great and terrible at the same time. The hotel is a good 15 minute walk from the Popello and 10 mins from Termini station so its in a nice quite part of the city. Seeing Rome in the snow is probably an experience not alot of people have which is cool but it did mean everything was closed and busy as the locals turned out to enjopy the spectacle. Seeing someone on skis by the Colloseum was interesting and someone sledging down the Circus Maximus in a dingy is up there too! The hotel is opposite a couple of ok restaurants. After trudging around in the snow there was no way we were walking back into town for dinner so they were really handy. The Greek place towards the station is nicer although clearly not italian. The room was comfortable and large enough. Breakfast was super although get in there early as it can be busy; lots of choice and good quality food. Hotel staff were very friendly english was excellent and even in the snowy conditions they were brilliant, despite not being able to drive home for 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights - 9/13 February. The staff were very friendly and welcoming from the time we arrived to when we left. Our room on the second floor overlooked the back of the hotel onto trees and gardens, cosy, very warm and comfortable. Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice. Bacon, eggs, sausages, all manner of continental selection. 15 minute walk to the Termini where you can access all the well known sites in Rome. We bought a 3 three day pass for 11 euros each so you can get on and off the metro, buses and tram wherever you need to. We bought ours in a tabac but you can get them at the metro and airport. Recommend using the metro to go to Vatican City (which is a must see, even if you're not religious) as the bus on the return journey didn't arrive. Metro runs every few minutes. Recommend the Pizzaria opposite the hotel (especially the tiramisu) and other restaurants close to the hotel recommended by the staff. We had a wonderful break in this beautiful city and the Italian people were very friendly, asking if they could help us when we looked lost. We would recommend Gambrinus and would definitely return. Thank you for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: June D
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful,room was very clean, warm, comfortable and cozy.(snowing in Rome at the time) Central location for sightseeing with busses only a short walk away. Restaurants also within walking distance. Breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice. Sausage, egg, bacon etc, cereal , fruit, toast...thoroughly recommend this Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: LinzGodfrey
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff were helpful and welcoming. They recommended a couple of local restaurants which were good. The room was cold (we stayed when it snowed) and we had to use the blankets provided (there was heating which we used but it was quite noisy). We were also not sure the room was thoroughly cleaned as there were empty shampoo bottles behind the shower screen when we arrived. Having said that breakfast was nice and the hotel was well positioned for the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very freindly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T0J0
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Gambrinus in a very cold Feb but the warmth of the staff and in fact the central heating was exceptionally high. Food was great the breakfast was substantial and good quality. The room was very good and done to a high standard. Connections for City were excellent bus stop to Termini right outside hotel. To get there we got a cab from the termini which was a fiver and the rest of the time used the bus services which were cheap and very frequent

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Gambrinus to be a great place to stay during a gloriously sunny November weekend in Rome. The location is 10-15 mins walking distance from the train station and slightly away from the main sights but with easy access to the bus right outside, the city is easily accessible.The friendly and helpful staff made our stay enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble, from a map and advice on getting around from Roberta, extra milk for a late evening coffee from the night staff, to the cheerful and attentive Ruel at breakfast. The rooms are adequate in size for a weekend stay but the showers are on the small side as commented elsewhere. This is only a small criticism as overall the hotel is clean and comfortable and good value for money. We would definately use the hotel again during our planned future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: JimandHel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights from 29th Jan. We were a party of six visiting Rome for my wife's birthday. The hotel is in a decent location, it's walking distance from the Termini, Spanish Steps & the Trevi Fountain (about 20-30 mins from each). The rooms were very nice, small but clean and equiped with everything you need, very comfortable bed and nice decor. The breakfast was very good, everything from cereal, pastries, fruit, bacon, eggs etc. Just what you need to set yourself up for a days sight-seeing (and with prices in Roman cafes/restaurants this is a bonus!). The staff are very friendly and helpful, the receptionists were always on hand to offer advice on bars & restaurants in the area as well as helping with catching buses or organising taxis. A big thanks to our breakfast waiter (I think his name was Raoul?) who sang happy birthday to my wife and then went on to wish her a happy birthday every morning of our stay! A very friendly guy who made an effort to make sure we had everything we needed. My only negative (and it's a very small one) is that the bar ran out of beer! If you're visiting Rome I would strongly recommend staying at the Gambrinus, I hope we return to Rome and stay here again someday (as we threw a coin in the Trevi fountain this will hopefully come true)

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ H
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a four night stay at Hotel Gambrinus. We received a friendly welcome and were immediately given a map of Rome on which the reception staff marked the hotel and all the main sites, including bus numbers and metro details. Really useful. The bedroom was clean and fair size with a brilliantly comfortable bed and excellent shower. Breakfast was very good buffet style with everything from fresh fruit and yoghurt, to cereals, cold meats and cheese to hot dishes, bread and cakes. The highlight of breakfast was undoubtedly Raoul the waiter who makes you feel very welcome. Hotel well placed for Terminii station - 10 minute walk so we took the train to and from the airport. Loads of excellent restaurants in the neighbourhood, so you are spoiled for choice. All the main sites are walking distance if you are fit or buses and metros very close by otherwise. The Villa Borghese up the street is a huge beautiful park if you fancy a jog or a leisurely stroll. Would thoroughly recommend Hotel Gambrinus.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all but the room are small”
Reviews.Author: LondonGislene
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good but the room is really small. the staff was marvellous. Roberta, she work at the reception , she is brillant and really healpfull. Puel from breakfast work alone, and sometimes is so busy. I'd would like to know if he has day off but he is perfect, polite and friendly. The location was no close by walking. Its better take a bus. If you want to sabe money is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Revisiting Gambrinus”
Reviews.Author: Russeren
Reviews.Content: Grandma, my vife and I and the useual gang of suspects are looking foreward to revisit Gambrinus and her neighbourhood restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Neil A
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I travelled to Rome just recently and had a really great time. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was decent but not great, but there was plenty of it. The rooms were pretty small, but very clean and we werent in the room for very long anyway, so it was fine for us. The location was amazing, about a ten minute walk from termini station and the same to another metro stop. We usually just walked to most of the sights and when going out for dinner at night. Would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarryLouisYeoh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a quiet area not far from the Termini Station. The rooms were pleasant and the service was impeccable for a hotel of this size. Victoria and Roberta at the reception were exceptionally efficient and very pleasing to converse with. They were well versed with the local transport systems and provided clear directions to the various tourist sites. My Grandchildren who travel often with my wife and I were very happy especially with the free internet. The breakfast room is very quaint cellar type place and the food served was hot and delicious with many choices of hot and cold dishes. The overall pricing is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant trip, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Terrisig
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay, rooms werent massive but perfectly set out, everything you need. Very clean aswell. The hotel staff were very nice and all very helpful. Went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Would recommend anyone to stay there. Perfectly located and a lovely breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing shower!”
Reviews.Author: LesT4
Reviews.Content: Firstly the water presure was so stringbthe shower was fantastic! The hotel was a lovely city hotel with individual charm. The staff were very friendly and spoke english. The hotel was within walking distance to all the main sights. There was not a great view from the room, but you are in a city so you expect to view other buildings. Rooms were clean and plenty of storage space. The breakfast was amazing, with plenty of cooked and cold food. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: blonde100
Reviews.Content: Just recently been here with my boyfriend and i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room we had wasnt very big but was nice and clean and had everything we needed. The staff there make the hotel. They are polite and helpful and gave us any information we needed regarding bus routes and site seeing, booking our taxis etc. Breakfast service is good we were seated straight away and looked after by a friendly waiter and asked if we were always ok and needed anything else. The breakfast selection was varied with croisants,toast,english breakfast,fresh fruit,yhoghurts, fresh juice,coffee etc. The loaction is brilliant with most things within a decent enough walking distance and for things a little further out theyre are plenty of bus stops nearby. The restaurant directly opposite the hotel we went to on our first night and the food was brilliant. Id more than recommend a visit there. I loved Rome and the Gambrinus hotel i would definately go again!

Reviews.Title: “second home”
Reviews.Author: kingkiwi_89
Reviews.Content: First day back home,I miss Rome and the hotel so much.I could have happily lived in the hotel..For the price you pay it is great value,friendly staff excellent location close to bus routes the met you could even walk..The breakfast was very nice and catered for anybody's needs or nationality.I would recommend this hotel to anybody it felt like home.There was a lovely little restaurant across the road as well that was nice food at good prices unlike some places in Rome where it is horrible food at double the price.When i return to Rome i will 100% look into staying at this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Viorica”
Reviews.Author: viorica c
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip to Rome through go-today and Gambrinus was offered as an upgrade to the basic package. I traveled beginning of January 2012 and found Gambrinus to be very well located and have very helpful staff. Close to Via Venetto, Villa Borghese and so forth the hotel also offers very friendly service. I would like to mention Roberta here - she helped me chose my first walking itinerary through Rome which has been a reference for all my stay there. Vittoria is to be mentioned as well - very valuable local imformation. Breakfast was good, room comfortable - overall Gambrinus is part of my very good memory of the Eternal Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jorge1712
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was really nice. The lobby on arrival looks great, the staff were really friendly offering us advice on where to go whilst our room was still being prepared. The lobby was nice enough to relax in and use the wifi when need be but luckily we ended up being on the first floor and were thus able to access wifi from our room! Breakfast was nice, with enough variety to keep us going for 4 days. Probably not any longer. The breakfast was was actually really pleasant, a cozy feel with hidden alcoves dotted around. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Within walking from Termini but if you have large bags grab the 38 bus for 3 stops. We were able to walk quite happily to most major locations but the bus links to the hotel were also really good. The room was fine. Clean, comfortable and a nice view. It was quite small but it didn't really matter - we only needed somewhere to rest our heads. If I were to go back to Rome I would stay here again without a doubt. Personally I wouldn't rate it as a 4 star hotel but the location, price and service all amounted to a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drisheen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year and had good value for the price paid. The hotel is excellently located with very helpful desk staff and a comfortable (if slightly musty) room. Breakfast was absolutely fine. But the real attraction was the quiet but very central location close to key bus routes and within walking distance of key sights including the Palazzo Barberini, Villa Borghese (you must book in advance) and some stunning churches including Boromini's San Carlo alla Quattro Fontane and Santa Maria della Vittoria the home of Bernini's Estacy of St Teresa. We had a reasonably priced meal at the Pizza restaurant across the road - but would recommend that you do some homework and try out places in Trastavere which are often cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service, breakfast top quality”
Reviews.Author: Nelson P
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked it through United Airlines, arrived Dec 4 in the morning and left Dec 7. We walked everywhere with maps & advice from the front desk, really enjoyed it. Wi-Fi worked very well, there were 2 computers available. Breakfast was awesome, good coffee, all kind of fruits, eggs, bacon, sausages, cheese and bread. Very friendly atmosphere, mainly European and Asian middle age couples. Not luxurious, but very good quality according to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petrita99
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel during my Rome trip in December 2011. The hotel is located on a quiet street, right next to the Embassy building, so don't get scared by armed policemen guarding on the street. It is in a very convenient locality, in walking distance from all Roman sightseeing spots.The hotel itself is nice and clean. Because it was not a season I got a really good price. The breakfast place itself did not impress me. I found the breakfast under the standard I would be expecting. But overall it was a level of service for the value of money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Gambrinus Experience - Very GOOOOOD”
Reviews.Author: Hash28
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Europe. Our first stop was the Rome where we stayed at the Gambrinus Hotel, Rome. The Hotel is ideally situated as it is within walking distance of the Rome Termini Station as well as the Trevi Fountain. When we got to the hotel we were welcomed very warmly by Fabio who had booked us in quickly, explained how everything works, as well as issued us a city map with instructions for the bus. The porter was very friendly as well. Our room was comfortable and not to brag, but was the only one with a Balcony. The breakfast was well-organised and the bar-man was very helpful. A definite return, I would say

Reviews.Title: “The eternal city conquered us”
Reviews.Author: Redfredc
Reviews.Content: An ambitious strategy - conquer Rome on foot in four days. Christmas was the ideal opportunity. It was four days of high adventure covering over 2,000 years of epic events and people. The hotel was great. A lovely quiet room overlooking the gardens of an embassy. A hearty breakfast. Excellent tactical advice from the staff who readily shared knowledge of locations, opening times, taxis, buses, metro, restaurants, etc. We thought we were winning. On the last morning it became obvious who actually won - Gambrinus and Rome had won our hearts and our minds. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a quiet area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: emmaandtom52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid December. The location is good if you are arriving via Termini as you can walk to the hotel easily. We found the reception staff very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very clean and a good size. The breakfast was okay, the 'english' breakfast options didn't look very appetising but we had coffee and some bread. The only downside was that our hotel room had an interconnecting door with another room so we could hear the guests in that room (and I'm sure they could hear us). The hotel is slightly outside the main tourist areas of Rome but you can walk to these easily (on one day when there was a transport strike we walked all the way to the Vatican and back) and there are some nice restaurants nearby which were far better than the ones we tried in central areas such as the Campo de Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vincentgoh82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there during our honeymoon from 16 Dec to 21 Dec. It is a wonderful hotel with wonderful staff like Ms Vittoria, Ms Roberta and of course the Mr Ruel at the breakfast venue who is very cheerful and never fails to greet us every morning with his smile. Overall quite a great experience staying in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can improve greatly”
Reviews.Author: B0nv0yage007
Reviews.Content: Pros: None Cons: The people at the reception desk are temperamental. They offered to give me a travel guide the very last day of my stay!?! The single room is tiny with a view on a dark courtyard. Mediocre breakfast in a sinister room. The TV had a very bad reception, and many disconnections. The hallways are dark and the carpeting looks old and dirty. The bathroom had a broken shower head, and a lot of mildew. The blankets reeked and looked as if they hadn't been washed in years. If you want to use the mini-fridge as in : put your own bottle of water for instance, they charge $20 a day!!! Rome has so many hotels, with a much better location - it's unbelievable that this one has landed 4 stars. It's barely a 2 star hotel. They benefit from a tight partnership with Expedia. Therefore, the positive reviews found on this website may likely be biased. I'll never come back to the Gambrinus, nor will I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Rome all the more pleasureable”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in the Gambrinus on the 13th Nov 2011, the staff couldn't have been friendlier. We got a great deal for the hotel booking through Expedia. The room was absolutely adequate for what we required. The first morning at breakfast the staff new we were "new kids on the block" and made sure that we were set up for sightseeing information for the coming days. The breakfast was excellent. We arrived late evening on the Sunday and the concierge recommended a fantastic traditional italian restaurant to us for our evening meal...we'd definitely go there again too. The bus stop was right outside the door and had us at the Termini in minutes. Everywhere was very accessible from the hotel, the first two days we didn't take any buses. Whenever we returned to the hotel there was a friendly face to greet us. I have to say the staff were fantastic, thanks to one and all, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: amyn23
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a long weekend break. The staff were very friendly & efficient and the room was comfortable & more than adequate for the two of us. Having never been to Rome before we were struggling to find what seemed like the best location to stay but everything was within walking distance (the furthest away was the Vatican which was maximum one hour away & that was a gentle stroll through the Borghese Park, so there are more direct routes). The value for money is excellent for the location & Via Veneto, which has some lovely restaurants for dinner, was a stones throw away! The Colosseum was only about a half hour walk. Would definately recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemgem_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night getaway. We arrived a little too early to check in but were advised to go to the pizzeria over the road which we then ended up doing every day, the food there was fantastic. The room on check in was lovely, although a standard room it was large with a massive comfy bed and good sized bathroom. the house keepers obviously work extremely hard as the rooms were spotless and faultless. Reception were very helpful especially Vittoria who couldn't do enough for us and took the time to go that extra mile with her knowledge of Rome, good places to eat, bus routes etc. Breakfast is one of the best I've had offering a large choice in a cosy dining room. All in all an excellent stay made even more comfortable by the staff. If we go to Rome again we will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I booked it !! :)”
Reviews.Author: Dungeonmaster42
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of the outstanding reviews on this website. 1. Very clean & well maintained. 2. Very professional & everyone friendly. 3. Pleasant stay 4. The experience from beginning to end was amazing. 5. Thank god for internet in the room :). 6. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks to the hotel for giving me a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: panch017
Reviews.Content: The reason of our stay was my fiancee birthday so i have a couple requests prior to our arrival, hotel staff organized everything what i asked for, they were very helpful and i really appreciate what they did for us. Reception desk staff, breakfast service staff all a 5 star for me. Hotel is in quiet location with bus stop outside the hotel. We have walked here from Termini Station and it took us only about 10 minutes. There are hotels closer to the main attractions but there is nothing far away in Rome everything is very central. All of the main sites are in walking distance. We had room 106 on the end of the corridor which is always good sign and was big enough with king size comfy bed and we even had on street balcony. Hotel is very clean and well decorated only carpets in corridors are outdated and could be replaced. If we are coming back to Rome we would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Thank you Hotel Gambrinus”
Reviews.Author: K_D429
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Rome and my friend and I spent a great deal of time choosing our hotel. We were not disappointed. The rooms, while a little small, were beautifully decorated and very clean. The hotel was smaller than many which added to the charm and friendly feel of Hotel Gambrinus. It is very well located (15min walk – or busses directly outside) to the train station that takes you to and from the airport, and also centrally located for many of Rome’s attractions. Above all however, ALL the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They not only booked restaurants and gave advice on must see places – they went above and beyond in helping me track down a lost phone. In particular I would like to thank Joseph and Vittoria. I will certainly be recommending this hotel to friends and family and hope to return one day. Thank you Hotel Gambrinus!

Reviews.Title: “Suboptimal location and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Villgraine
Reviews.Content: Quiet and peaceful spot fairly faraway from more active and attractive areas, such as Trastevere and Pantheon surroundings. Rooms were small and without WiFi. Only one functioning lift which you sometimes had to wait for a long time. Frankly, nothing special or unique in this hotel, in European standards. Very good service at the breakfast. Friendly service overall. In any case, Rome is always super exceptional, no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU Hotel Gambrinus!!”
Reviews.Author: Sitkasky
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome :-) We were at this hotel for a week. My husband and I had tours set up and on one day we had to cancel one and make sure we would be picked up for another tour. They were happy to have helped us to make sure the tour company would be there to pick us up (or not to pick us up). I can't thank Miss Roberta enough.. she was amazing and wonderful always to me. THANK YOU!! Don't get me wrong, they were all very helpful at the desk, and willing to help you. Ahh but my favorite.. RAUL!! he works in the restaurant for the morning breakfast. (which by the way was FANTASTIC! Have NEVER had such a good breakfast in Europe!) He was always pleasant and greeted us like family.. On my birthday.. he sang me (with another gentleman that worked there) Happy Birthday.. I LOVED it.. it was part English.. part Italian.. Raul.. you are always in my prayers.. HUGS to you!!I will never forget, it is special always to me. It was an amazing trip.. It was for my Birthday and what a way to spend Thanksgiving! We really loved the room.. the bed was kind of too firm for me.. but I believe you can ask for a mattress pad.. which I learned my last day there. Our room didn't have a view.. but it was sure a great sized room, especially for Europe. I will always cherish and love my memories of Rome.. but mostly.. of all of you at Hotel Gambrinus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Janice M
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in Hotel Gamrinus and really enjoyed it. When we opened our window, we saw a lovely old pine and the rooftop garden next door. Our room was quiet, well equipped, and nicely decorated. The staff arranged for opera tickets at a small theatre walking distance from the hotel the first night. The staff also pointed us to local restaurants which had good food at reasonable prices. We enjoyed the hotel inclusive breakfast. Each time we asked which bus on our Roma pass would take us to a certain destination, the staff immediately jotted on our map the bus number and told us where to catch it. Most buses left across the street from the hotel or a block away. We would certainly stay at Hotel Gambrinus again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: AKS_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights b&b, very good location, walking distance to many sights and near to his stops, few good eating places nearby. Free computer / wifi access from 1100-2300 in breakfast area. Helpful staff, good service. Only problems noted- corridor at our floor had a smell and carpet looked dirty but room was clean. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agnes O
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed when we arrived at the hotel about 2 hours before check-in. Vittoria gave us a map outlining the sites within walking distance and the buses we could get nearby to take us to The Vatican, Colosseum. etc. We had a lovely hour or so walking in the Borghese Gardens closeby. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely and very clean and breakfast was very good. When we were leaving Mr Joe and Ms Roberta gave us a lovely guidebook on Rome. Agnes & John

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: Lee L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the train station and is an ideal base for seeing Rome. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and tidy and had everything that you could need. The breakfast was reasonable and Ruel looked after our every need. I would use this hotel again when I next visit Rome because beleive me, you will certainly want to come back again and again. Try the pizza accross the road, it is a winner!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie H
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel was extremely clean and located in a safe, quiet, and convenient location. There are very good restaurants nearby. The hotel staff is very friendly and efficient. They provided us with a city map suggesting sites to see and how to get there. They arranged a tour to Capri and airport transportation for us also. I would stay here again and definitely recommend it for other travelers to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Well Run”
Reviews.Author: simonkim
Reviews.Content: The Hotel in its self is in a good location to get about the city.. The Breakfast is a great start to the day plenty of choice for all tastes. The staff are very helpful and nothing is to much trouble. like a few people have mentioned i was in a economy room so hey lets be realistic(dont expect to much) it was clean and ok for the money,unfortunately i was on the 4th floor right next to the lift shaft so a bit noisy up & down starting early and finishing late.... but the worst thing was the bathroom and shower both far to small. But to ok for price paid(only just)

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, well run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L M H
Reviews.Content: Staff at the Gambrinus are so helpful and welcoming. They gave us advice regarding Tours,booked them for us, and the Tour Bus collected us from the Hotel. Getting back to the Hotel, which is set in a quieter less Touristy area was not difficult and the staff were helpful in giving us the bus numbers to get back. It is easy to get around as you do have a few choices on offer, Metro, Bus or simply walking and famous attractions are not too far away. We wanted a hot drink on our return and it was never too much trouble to bring us fresh milk when we requested it. Our room and bathroom were very clean, my only regret was that it did not have a view other than the inner courtyard, it was incredibly quiet for living in a City! Room 419 if you are interested. Breakfast had enough choice with both English or continental breakfasts on offer and charming staff, who quietly went about their work. We enjoyed 3 nights at the Hotel and on our final day the staff were very helpful in storing our luggage until we were ready to collect it to return home. We would stay again in this welcoming, clean, well run Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fernga
Reviews.Content: We booked the Gambrinus on lastminute.com and had an economy room. The room far exceeded out expectations, really lovely and very quiet. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself is in a great location. it is really nicely maintained and beakfast was great. We mainly used the metro at Castro Pretorio, just over 10 minutes walking which connected us to the Centro Storico in less than 10 minutes! There is a supermarket beside the metro which is v. handy. The Spanish Steps are a 15- 20 minute walk. May I also recommend the restaurant 'Da Vincenzo' which is just around the corner, really nice for dinner if you are having a chilled evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel -- Good value, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: UpperEastGal
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal to all the sights (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Ancient Rome) are within walking distance (15-30 blocks). Train station is nearby too if one isn't a walker. The staff from the reception desk to the managers are friendly and helpful -- five stars for service. Certainly, if one is used to the likes of Mandarin Hotel, Waldorf you would be dissappointed (then again you would be paying alot more at those hotels) -- this is more like a lovely boutique hotel (wonderful value) -- we found our room clean, stylish and functional. Perfect for a base for a five day sightseeing excursion. Breakfast buffet had a wide variety and is a perfect start to fuel up before a day of sightseeing. Again, staff efficient and friendly. Highly recommend, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Boas1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Gambrinus and enjoyed it very much. The room was clean and had a very good bed. The bathroom was small but had everything you need and was clean as well. Breakfast had enough choice and was run by an excellent and friendly employee of the hotel named Ruel. The location is perfect, close to metro stations, the Colloseum and Forum Romanum. would definitely stay here again. all the best Maarten and Marise

Reviews.Title: “Short trip”
Reviews.Author: janet46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights earlier this month. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and the waiter in charge was efficient and worked hard to keep the tables cleared. The room was ok not a lot of space but adequate for a short stay. The bathroom was extremley small and cramped. We walked from Termini but there are plenty of buses. We also walked from the hotel to the main sites. This hotel was in a quiet street with a few restaurants nearby. We felt safe at all times.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kasia k
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights, very pleased,great location, lovely staff,our room was immaculately clean(the only downside was small window which I guess varies from room to room), good value for money ,would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Dana C
Reviews.Content: After staying a few days at the Crowne Plaza, we were very pleased with the Gambrinus Hotel. The location was centralized where we could walk to the highlighlights of Rome like the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain etc. It was also very close to the major metro station (Termini) fast train, and buses. We went to Rome for 3 days before heading off to a Mediterranean Cruise, the 1st location was overpriced, no wi-fi etc, walking distance only to a bus stop.....but when we returned we found the Gambrinus!! Score! Half the price, centrally located, free wi-fi, free breakfast, clean, accommodating staff. Would definitely recommend. The only downside was a power outage. It was morning so I didn't call the front desk, but upon going downstairs was told that the bldg had not lost power, but perhaps visitors in the next room overloaded the power outlet. Had I called, I'd have known sooner. Oh,,,,and their was complimentary water in the fridge! Rare, lol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality at Hotel Gambrinus Roma”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes S
Reviews.Content: I'm a CNN en Espanol anchor. The summer of 2011, As I traveled through Italy with my husband, daughter and son in our first trip to Italy, we stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus after visiting four other Italian cities. we arrived by car, having rented one to leave Florence and explore Tuscany. After facing the crazy one way streets and disorienting directions that led to our hotel, my husband was happy to drop us all of at the lobby to head over to the car rental place to return the car. I proceeded to check the family into two adjoining rooms and to unpack to take advantage of the free afternoon for sightseeing when he returned. It wasn't long before I noticed our video camera missing. It was a brand new $600 Sony I had just purchased to document our vacation and whose video I was also counting on including in a secret, this is your life type of presentation I was hoping to present my daughter with the following month as birthday gift. The memories, more than the value of the camera itself, was what was most important to me. I asked the young girl at the desk to help me track down the car from the rental company, convinced I had left it inside. She got me through to some voice mails that I couldn't understand. I felt hopeless and when my husband finally arrived we decided to return to the car rental to check in person. We left that afternoon to explore Rome without my joy in my heart. The dispatcher at the rental company assured us that the car was no longer in the shop as it had already been re-rented and nothing was found inside. I was crushed. Several hours later, after visiting the fountain of Trevi, the Spanish steps and having a very nice dinner we returned to the hotel to unexpected news. The same young girl at the desk, whom we later found out was named Ilaria, was the daughter of the owner, and was on her first week at the front desk of the family business, had stayed on the phone for two hours after we left. She found the manager of the car rental company, insisted on further investigation into the loss of our camera and actually got it returned! We not only got out video camera but our memories back. I came back to the states and finished my daughter's video surprise, which made my daughter thrilled and my husband cry. We could not be more happy to recommend Fabio's hotel, or his daughter Ilaria's hospitality. These are the types of family businesses that help us remember why family businesses are still so important in our society. This is where the larger, maybe more luxurious hotels can't compete. It's in the sensibility of a 17 year old girl understanding what it would mean to a 15 year old that her mother had spent years saving videos of her to gift her during a coming of age birthday party. Thank you Ilaria. We are grateful for your honesty, hard work and the serious responsibility you take to work with you every day. Work ethic matters at any age. You are a proven professional already. I hope many more travelers get to meet you and stay in your wonderful family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!! close to everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericka19842007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Had room with breakfast. Staff so helpful and breakfast excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Gambrinus”
Reviews.Author: WrightstuffSurrey
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome after a 3 day break. Stayed at he Gambrinus and enjoyed the stay. Rooms are a good size and comfortable. Usual facilities including hotel safe, fridge and lovely shower. Overlooked the garden and nice view. Staff were particular lovely and very helpful every step of the way. Only slight downside was the quality of the cooked breakfast (first day was slightly cold). Location wise is within walking distance of all the main attractions (except vatican city) but still out of the way enough to get away from the hustle and bustle. All in all very happy and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: JANIS J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gambrinus in early October. It was a great base for visiting the city. Every person who works ar the hotel was friendly, helpful & went out of their way to make my stay comfortable & pleasant. The rooms were nice & the breakfast was a great way to start the day. Traveling alone I was concerned at first, until i met the folks at the Gambrinus.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yobanesa
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 nights stay. The reception people were welcoming n helped us in organizing tours in just 30min of booking. The breakfast was good but the rooms are small. The bus stop is in front the hotel. There's a lovely Pizza Resturant across the street, Oohh they have world best pizza, I highly recommend them. I'll book there again

Reviews.Title: “Graham and Linda”
Reviews.Author: GrahamL90
Reviews.Content: Excellent and well-run hotel. Very friendly staff - especially the receptionists, Roberta and Vittoria who are so helpful. Superb breakfast with selection of cheeses, cooked meats, bacon, scrambled eggs - excellent coffee too. Everything very enjoyable plus lots of good restaurants nearby and all the sights within walking distance or a short taxi trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel to use as a base to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: bobarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gambinus in the last week of October and were blessed with beautiful weather, good food, excellent wine and the very helpful staff at the hotel. The reception staff advised us on local restaurants (which of course is a major factor when visiting a city) and gave helpful advice on a number of occasions.The hotel is situated in a nice area of Rome and we found it quite easy to see the whole city from this point. Yes some of the hills can be a little strenuous but for the most we walked to nearly all of the large sites. The hotel staff advised that the local bus ran from just at the end of the street to the Vatican which of course is and must be the main reason for visiting Rome.It really is that amazing. The rooms at the hotel are smallish but ample as you really do only need to sleep there. The bathrooms are adequately furnished,clean and well looked after.The breakfast is ample for everybody with plenty of choice.It really is a smashing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to work from. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandRob
Reviews.Content: We had read a few indifferent reviews of this Hotel but we found the Hotel excellent in the budget range. The room, a twin, was small but very clean and the shower small but useable. As we intended to sightsee every day the hotel was only a base to work from and from that point of view it fits the bill exactly. Breakfast was good and plentiful, service was good with all the staff friendly. Though you may neeed to remind them if you have asked them to do something for you, they will do it eventually. The bar is a little understocked so do not expect to get a selection of nightcaps. The location is in the quiet Embassy district right next to the French embassy so expect to see armed guards about. I suspect this makes the area much safer than most. For seeing all the sights in the iold town it is a little walk from the Hotel to a suitable metro stop but no more than 10 mins and most of the old city attractions are within walking distance in about 30 mins. Access from the main railway station "Termini" is best achieved by walking which takes approx 10 mins.
