We were very glad to have been advised to choose a hotel away from the centre and the Gambrinus turned out to be a good choice. I would definitely return and recommend others to choose this Hotel. Only two little annoyances, the booking had stated that the tourist tax was per room but the Hotel rules said per person. Not a big problem but a little annoying when everything elsa had been positive. And the Wi fi worked but only on the main hotel network in the lobby, we could not get it to work in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable! (in a great way!)The Gambrinus Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: DanV-Aust
Reviews.Content: I brought my 74 year old mum to Europe (from Australia) for her birthday. Rome was our first leg after 29 hours of flying from Melbourne, via Hong Kong and London. So you can imagine we were both a tad tired on arrival. The week before leaving, I had checked the Airport web site for details on Taxi costs and length of drive from the airport to the city. As the airport website warned of being conned by illegitimate cab drivers, I emailed the hotel asking if they provided a transfer service. They were very prompt in responding advising they could arrange a car transfer at a cost of 60€ which compared very well to the amounts quoted on the airport website. We were met as we came out of customs by the driver with our names written on a sign. From that first experience to the moment we left all I can say is that the hotel and it's people were fantastic! They welcomed us, made my mum feel special all the time. From the reception team to the people running the breakfast room (really great food - very tasty and many options) - you were all brilliant. The owner even came up to us at breakfast and had a chat. I had no problems with the location - always felt safe. We walked all over Rome and just got a cab back to the hotel. The rooms are small, as were the showers in both rooms (but then again - I could afford to lose 30 kilos!) but are tastefully appointed. Also very clean. I asked reception to arrange a couple of things for my mum as a surprise and they did so with great interest and joy. As a surprise, they helped me arrange a 1/2 day classic Fiat tour even coming out to check out the car and wave to my mum as we drove off. Guys - all hotels offer the same service a place to sleep and feel safe whilst away from home. What differentiates one from the other is the overall customer experience. The Gambrinus Hotel Rocks!!! And this is because of the great team behind the brand. You made my mum feel so special - thank you so much. I hope to come back to Rome by myself in the next 18 months - I will definitely stay there again! I recommend the Gambrinus Hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel option”
Reviews.Author: Kerswell
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay in this hotel, which provided everything we had hoped for. Conveniently situated some 10 minutes walk from the central railway station, the reception staff are welcoming and helpful. Our room was comfortable, and although there was some traffic noise from the street, it was not too intrusive. Most of the main sights are within reasonable walking distance, though we took buses one way to the Vatican and Colosseum to save time and reduce some of the walking. The stops are close by, and the hotel provided an excellent map, and highlighted what we needed to know. Breakfast was excellent. A good value hotel, which we would not hesitate to use again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: valeria b
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. Excellent: location, amenities, breakfast, kindness of the staff, cleanliness... They have wifi only at at the reception floor. It would be nice if this service was availble at the rooms. Anyway, it is still the best hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “top service”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location it is not in downtown but it´s located in the city center about 15 minutes walking distance from attractions, a bus stop is just on ther opposite side of the Hotel , all the staff was really helpfull , Mrs Roberta, Mr Giuseppi and Mrs Vittoria gave us the best tips always smiling . rooms are not to big but very clean and sharp , Air con was working well .The breakfast room is located on the ground floor and it´s very very good with plenty of fresh fruit , Mr Ruel was serving breakfast he also was very nice and always had a smile for us. I think this is a nice Hotel for a stay in Rome because it´s not to expencive and you get a good service .

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodgings”
Reviews.Author: wearymom3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus the last week of September, 2011. First things first - this hotel is NOT centrally located to Old Rome sites - the Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. You would need to take the #60 bus, which is located two blocks over and a block down from the hotel. Warning - trying to get on the #60 bus in the morning or afternoon is a royal pain. The buses are VERY crowded with commuters, and they will absolutely pack themselves in on the bus. So if you have an issue with "personal space" it might be best to take a taxi! We did purchase a day pass but the buses were so crowded! We watched an older woman wait through four buses before she finally pushed her way on. The front desk personal is very helpful - especially Dano and Roberta. They speak very good English, and are willing to give pointers on areas to see and do in Rome. We did not get the name of another of the desk clerks - who looked like an overly-tanned George Hamilton. Do NOT ask him for directions - he says "everything is easy". His directions are too confusing and nowhere close to where he says. Our reservation had said "option to upgrade to contemporary room" but we were never given the option to see a "regular" room. We ended up spending an extra 40 euro a night. We did not realize this until we checked out because we had pre-paid our room through our travel agent. Our room was nice - very New York loft-style. The air conditioning was adequate but could have worked better, especially since it was quite hot and humid while we were there. The complimentary breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Marie P
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. You can get to some of the sights walking about 10 minutes. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful with an excellent breakfast, however as this hotel is extremely busy food at breakfast can run out so dont leave it too late to go down. I only have one critism of this hotel. On our first night we used the tea/coffee making facilities in our room but they did not replace the cups, we had to ask for clean cups, also they did not replace the coffee sachets and there was no milk in the room. All in all we would be more than happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to sites”
Reviews.Author: holiday_boy84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip to Rome, a reasonable price for a good hotel within walking distance to some of the sites and an easy bus ride to the others. A bus to the Vaticam took around 25 mins and about 10 mins to Colloseum. The Spainish Steps and Trevi Fountain are probably a 20 minute walk. The staff on reception were always very helpful with directions or any other queries you may have. The room was fairly small but we weren't in it much anyway, there is not much room so don't bring too much stuff! Our room was at the front and the noise from the road can be heard when you lay down at night but we manged to get off to sleep. I did request a room at the back but I think I left it too late as I only asked the day before we traveled. It was very clean and the towels were changed everyday. The breakfast was nice and there was a good selection. We used the internet downstairs a couple of times and they were generally available. We arrived at 12 and the room was not ready, we were told check in was 2 but they had the room ready for us a bit sooner than that. I would suggest researching places to eat or getting recommendations because places we just stumbled upon weren't the best quality or value.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel within walking distance to train station and landmarks”
Reviews.Author: Kstephens70
Reviews.Content: This was a cute hotel. It was very European being very small, but considering the amount of time actually spent in the room that really wasn't a deal breaker. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “tiny”
Reviews.Author: Andy48305
Reviews.Content: fine if you are on a budget-rooms are tiny-but clean-area is out of the way-staff was trying to be helpful but ther's not much around there for them to be helpful about-breakfast buffet was below average-fruit cocktail was the equivalent of delmontes out of a can-hotel was clean however and reasonbly quiet-again-its fine if you are on a budget but no place to come back to after a hard day-we asked for an upgrade and was told the hotel was full even thought hat clearly wasn't the case

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Stay, but A-OK!”
Reviews.Author: TomVee
Reviews.Content: Just a few steps from Via XX Septembre, a main artery into Rome, and situated next door to the French embassy to the Vatican, Hotel Gambrinus (HG), is an older multi-story hotel that has been renovated and refreshed. It DOES have an elevator (be sure you check your accomodations in Rome!). A walk of about 15 minutes gets you to the Piazza Republica, with Metro Line. 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps area. 12 minutes to Termini. Smallish marbled lobby, with a nice sitting area closeby (free WI-FI). Sleeping rooms are located on the upper floors, and the hotel's layout, while a bit quirky, works fine. Hot water, adequate A/C, and sweet maid staff. The best thing about the hotel is the staff...very, very attentive (Dario, Fabio, Mr. Gils among others..you were excellent). Our group of twenty was handled with courtesy and care. No problems giving recommendations, calling for taxis. etc. The experience was very positive, and I would recommend the hotel. Another positive about HG is the breakfast. It's a REAL breakfast, not just bread, jam, ceral. There were eggs, bacon, and more...a real hit with our group.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, quiet locale.”
Reviews.Author: kamonkids
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at Gambrinus. We are on a 3 week tour of Italy, just the two of us, and were trying to book central, good value 3 star hotels throughout. Gambrinus fit the bill, although the location was a lot quieter than I had expected. The room was small, the bathroom smaller, but that's standard in Italy I'm finding. One gripe was that the room was interconnecting with someone else's room, and we could hear a lot of what went on through the door. So make sure you get a separated room. Also, the wi-fi is only available in the lobby and small bar adjoining the lobby, so if you want to Skype, like we did, th e conversation will be in full view of anyone else there. Slightly annoying, but not enough to mar the experience of the hotel. No view, but they had everything else, including a good breakfast selection and really helpful staff. The location is a little walk to a metro, which is good as far as it goes, and relatively close to a bus stop that gets you to most parts of the city (bus 62 will take you to piazza Navone from via XX septembre, bus 90 takes you to Termini). there is a laundry place about 3 streets away, and some nice pizzerias and trattorias in the area, but not as many as say trastevere or closer into the city. All in all I thought it was good value for money, but if you're only in Rome for a short time, I would maybe choose somewhere more central. All in all I thought it was good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and located close to transport.”
Reviews.Author: Climbsome
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms (no carpet thank goodness) with double windows and shutters overlooking the busy street. Basically no street noise. Free Wifi, but it only works in the lounge adjacent to the lobby. Good breakfast, but the last 15 minutes isn't good as they start winding down and packing up, with cold eggs and no fruit etc. Not far from the main train station and bus stop immediately outside. Cheap restaurants very close. Tours pick up from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Liliana A
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities are very nice. The location is good as it is in a good zone at bus distance from the turistic places. The service is excellent! We felt very comfotable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexRupert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel foe 3 nights, it is ideally placed to visit all tourist attractions.The room was very clean, but the bathroom was very small and the shower cubicle was quite a challenge.The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Got moved on arrival”
Reviews.Author: southkh3557
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay early September but got moved to the Bailey Hotel upon arrival due to an issue with the air conditioning or some similar issue. the location is a little far out. The Baileys is about 2 minutes closer to the central and that was quite a hike back. This area contains mostly embassies from what I could see so it is nice and quiet, some tranquility away from the centre at least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, A bit far from the attractions in Rome though”
Reviews.Author: DaithiJ
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Very nice staff. No free wifi in the rooms. Room was big and well set out with tea, coffee etc. This hotel is very nice, but the only problem is the location.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: expressmagic
Reviews.Content: just come back from a 4 day break. The hotel was lovely, clean, quiet. The staff were brilliant, helpful, always greeted with a smile. Fabio was fantastic. The breakfast had a wide choice of food, was nice and fresh, The room was clean and tidy, had room 106 with a balcony which was lovely to sit out on and have a cup of tea. Would most definitley stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hopkins825
Reviews.Content: Could not really fault this hotel in any way. The room we had was 106 which was great as it had a balcony to sit out on. It was also very well equipped and clean,. The staff were great and very helpful in explaining how to get to all the attractions. The location was good with a bus stop opposite and about a 10 min walk to the nearest metro at Republica which is a great area for shopping and bars. A very good pizza place opp the hotel as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again when in Rome. A big thank you to Fabio and his team for making us feel so welcome and our stay in Rome a great 4 days. Thank you Adrian & Bev Hopkins

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Friendly but Small”
Reviews.Author: asavia
Reviews.Content: Small friendly hotel in a convenient location in Rome about 15 minutes walk from central train and bus station easy access for site seeing tours etc. Small clean room at front of building facing the main street (bus stop directly oposite) so a bit noisy. Needed the air conditioning as August was very hot 34-37C degrees. Breakfast was very good, great choice but get there early before 9am. Airport pick up from Ciampino arranged through hotel was a bit expensive at 60 euros but as we arrived late evening felt it was the safest option.

Reviews.Title: “why did i out of all the hotels in rome endedup here?”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: guys i dont want to talk bad about rome as i love love rome. the hotel on the other hand is another story. we arrived the front desk slick chain smoker guy was not about to make the americans happy. i do sense they think Americas are idiots. they knew our expedia rate to be quite low so they gave us a room the size of shoe box. sure we were not happy so they said "oh well now pay 70 euro (100 dollars) upgrade to a suite". i will share the picture of our "suite" for you guys to see! the air condition unit in the room will not work unless the key is in the spot to switch lights off and on. so when we left the ac was turn off we came back to the room in 95c degrees outsize the room was a sauna! the breakfast room which was including in our rate is in the basement tiny room with no air condition ! and on top of it awful breakfast with lousy service. all will be ok... maybe..if the wifi will work. well it didn't! not in the lobby nor in our "suite" and the front desk guy had to nerves to say to me "madam you are in rome what do you need a wifi"???!!! well...i guess they have not arrived to 2011. the location of the hotel is ok. the lobby is ok .is just that too many things were not. one good thing to say? well its next to some embassy with army gurds each one of them were better looking then the other. smiling don't go there trust me i was not thinking i went to the ritz (even the ritz can let you down at times...smiling) but it was a big let down stay! yet i love Rome~

Reviews.Title: “Sure I will be back”
Reviews.Author: james r
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for a business trip. The hotel was a bit out from the centre of the city but near my office in Rome. The bus system was ok there is plenty of buses going to the main attractions. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The room was a bit small but clean and very well equipped also with coffee facilities and iron to iron my shirts. Last but not the least...a great hug to Mr Fabio. He is a very special person. He helped me during all my stay and also to find a good restaurant in Testaccio!!! thanks Fabio I will be back soon! James R. (London)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sophie476
Reviews.Content: Was a really lovely hotel with freindly staff especially Fabio who was great. The rooms were lovely and the location was great also. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicky L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my 11 year old son. The hotel was very clean and the service and helpfulness of the people who work there was great. The hotel is close to many of the sites with a very good bus service nearby, walking distance from a very nice park where you can hire bikes or row in a small lake, great for kids with zoo nearby. Very nice staff especially Victoria, Fabio and Roberta who gave us directions to everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: srobs_11
Reviews.Content: We had read some of the reviews prior to our visit but were prepared to view this hotel with an open mind. It is only a 10 minute walk from the front of the huge Termini station to the hotel. The room we had (111) was small and compact but perfectly functional. For the money we paid we certainly didn't have any complaints. The staff at the hotel were fantastic especially the blonde haired girl (we didn't get her name) who couldn't have been more helpful with directions and information. The hotel location suited us just fine. It is approximately a 20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, 30 minutes to centro storico district. The buses are superb and cost 1 euro for any journey. They are very easy to use. Breakfast was basic but a good selection available. The area around the hotel had some good restaurants and we always felt perfectly safe walking back at nightime from our long days sightseeing. The wifi didn't work in our room but computers were available in the breakfast room. Overall we were happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 44west
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening and were a little concerned about the location as it seemed to be away from the main points of interest. The receptionist and porter were friendly and helpful and we were shown to our room (210) this was far too small to be classed as a double so we didnt bother to unpack our bags. We went back to reception to ask advice about where to eat locally, the food was excellent and reasonably priced. We informed reception regarding our disappoitment with the room and were moved the next day to room 208, much bigger but facing the back of another building. Air con very efficient and quiet. Rooms and hotel spotlessly clean and all members of staff were friendly and helpful. Our fears regarding the location were unfounded as we managed to walk to everywhere apart from the Vatican where the transport was so easy and cheap it didn't matter. The breakfasts were a little disappointing but again the waiter was so nice we didn't like to complain. Would probably return as the price is reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newer portion a couple doors down from the main hotel. The room was beautifully renovated and large (by Italian standards). The hardwood floors and modern bathroom were beautiful. They even arranged a car service (not a cab) to take us to the airport for less than a cab would have cost. The highlight was the service. We accidentally left a pen (a nice one, and with sentimental value) in the car on the way to the airport. We were unable to let them know until we landed in the US. Roberta from the hotel located the driver, found the pen, and mailed it to us free of charge. Thanks to Roberta and the Gabrinus staff. We will be back. Roger and Jess Long Beach, CA

Reviews.Title: “A reliable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Wix2
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel in Rome. We were here 5 years ago and liked it so we used it again. Firstly, thanks to Roberta for all her help with our lost bank card. You were always pleasant to us whether in person or on email. Thanks for that. This hotel is located a little out of the main tourist area in Rome but is easily reached by walking, metro or bus. The room is small but has extras in it which make it worthwhile (hair dryer, iron, water) but the Wifi in the room never worked on any our our visits (3 in total). Wifi could only be accessed from the lounge in the lobby. They also have two computers for guest use. The staff are very helpful (will allow you to print out plane tickets, etc.) and they have the break breakfast of anywhere in Italy! Try out the restaurants around the hotel. They were all great!

Reviews.Title: “DONT BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS! AMAZING HOTEL, DEFINITELY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: jakes101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from the 22/07/11 to 29/07/11 as a young couple. We both thought that this hotel was brilliant. The breakfast had a good selection of food; loads of pastries, cereals, breads, cooked ham, fruit, scrambled egg, tea, coffee and a range of juices - breakfast is served from 7 - 10 and would recommend getting there early ish for a better selection of the pastries. The hotel is in a PERFECT location. It is about a 10 minute walk from a main strip of restaurants which includes the famous hard rock cafe (which won the best hard rock in 2010) amongst this there are many other great restaurants. We didn't eat a bad meal in Rome and ate at this strip most nights. Also the Pizzeria directly opposite the hotel served up the best pizza we had in Rome! and was very well priced. Also location wise the hotel is in walking distance of the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza novona, campo di fiori and the pantheon all ranging from 10-25 minute walk max. The hotel itself was lovely. All the staff, particularly reception and breakfast waiter, were very friendly and helpful. We had to ring green line tours to confirm our trip to Naples and Pompei and had to also ring and confirm our shuttle service to the hotel which the front desk were happy to do for us. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND GOING TO POMPEI!!!!!!!!! The room was nicely decorated and well cleaned everyday, even if you decide to have a morning off and stay in the hotel room it will still get cleaned in the afternoon. Free wi-fi was available in the lobby but had to pay a cost for it in the room. However we didn't have time to sit around on the internet as there is so much to see in Rome. When we got to the Colosseum we were asked if we wanted to do a tour which included the roman forum and Palentine hill, skipping the queue's. This was 100% value for money. The lady's name who does part of the tour is Elaine and she also does tours of the Vatican and we skipped a 3 hour queue for doing the tour with her. Her number is +[...] - definitely worth giving her a call.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno666
Reviews.Content: I saw the two very negative recent reviews. Our experience couldn't have been more different. Well, yes, at the train station, the taxi wanted 25 euro to drive us to Gambrinus, which I knew was about 0.57 miles. Wife says the hell with that! So we walk it in 10 minutes. Desk clerk was great. First thing he does is locate hotel on the tourist map, circles the major attractions and gives us restaurant recommendations. Vatican City, Coliseum were maybe 20 minutes walk if going directly but of course we stopped and shopped and made many detours. Breakfast selections maybe not the greatest, but breakfast staff was attentive and cheerful. 2 self serve coffee makers were a plus. Rooms are clean and updated. Very nice bath area! There is free wireless in the lobby area and pay wireless in the rooms. Used the free wireless in lobby as the desk clerk recommended against the pay wireless and that was fine. Two doors down the street is some sort of embassy and there are armed guards sitting outside. I think those are the guns the Canadians are talking about. Frankly, I saw them as a source of comfort. In Paris, the military patrols the entire city with machine guns, which I liked also. Obviously these are societies that take the terrorist threat seriously. Evening before departure, desk clerk reserved limo to airport. Next day, driver arrives 10 minutes early. We were transported to FCO efficiently for 55 euro. We had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: rrtravelsRome
Reviews.Content: We are part way through our stay at Gambrinus Hotel and are loving every minute. The rooms are stylishly decorated, clean and comfortably small; the staff are welcoming, helpful and professional; the location safe, quiet and offers small and local dining opportunities of traditional Italian fare; and the bus system from the front of the hotel leads to most places of interest....as does a refreshing walk!! Special thanks to Fabio for his cheerful assistance - nothing is too difficult - and the breakfast room staff are amazing!! We are looking forward to the rest of our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “SCARY EXPERIENCE. DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: emitheisa
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Termini Station and were promptly scammed by the "taxi driver" for a 5 minute ride to this hotel. Arrived at the hotel. Overly emotional hotel clerk proceeds to take my passport and say that my birthday was the worst day of his life and almost start to cry. Travelling alone with my mother, English speaking Canadians. Get to the room, open up the windows, find one is overlooking something and there is a soldier with a huge gun about 10 feet from our window, we don't understand why. Try to call out on the phone to family in Canada to check in. Can't get through and internet does not work. Called Reception and am given information. Information provided for both phone and internet still does not work. Telephone reception again and confirm information. Information still does not work.Starting to feel a little uneasy at this point. Go down to reception in person and find correct information to call Canada on the HOTEL DESK RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE CLERK and ask clerk to write it down. Clerk writes it down but leaves out a zero. I add the zero. Clerk all of a sudden also has a print out of the internet sign in information for the hotel that is nothing like the first information he gave me for the first half hour where he was telling me the password just a word. Internet still doesn't work, finally get through to Canada and phone hangs up for no reason when telling family about the situation...Anyway, between the guns and the weird hotel clerk we were so freaked out that we booked another hotel on my rental smartphone and left. Hotel clerk kept asking where we were going and why we did not like the hotel as he was almost crying. People in lobby looked at us as if they understood why we were leaving. Were refused refund and had to pay for 3 nights when we only stayed 45 mins before leaving for a Best Western. I have travelled many places and have never felt uncomfortable in my hotel but this hotel (and Rome in general) gave me the ultimate creeps. No offer of compensation was made by hotel clerk and he charged us 3 nights tax in addition to full price. Aside from this experience the rooms have almost no plugs and the neighbourhood surrounding the hotel is SKETCHY...the hotel also did not seem close to many tourist sites at all...Seriously just go somewhere else...this is DEFINITELY not a 4 star...I would not walk in this area after dark as a single female traveller...or as a female traveller in a small group....

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful finale to Italy”
Reviews.Author: LSpittal
Reviews.Content: After being taken advantage of by a taxi driver at the train station we arrived at our hotel arranged through Expedia and the desk personnel were marvelous. They gave us wonderful advice, directions, were fluent in English and friendly. The actual room was beautiful and the location great. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Superb staff!!! Higly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: theclutchshooter10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Gambrinus Hotel for five days on May 2011 with my girlfriend. At the check in, there is a philipino doorboy that helps you with the luggage. But the best surprise is when you reach the front desk. All the staff, most of all Victoria, Fabio and Guiseppe (the red one that works during the night shift) is very nice and helpful, always smiling to customers and always ready to help you for all your needings. The hotel is placed near Via Veneto, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel, so you can easyly reach the center of the eternal Rome- The rooms are not so big but are very clean and restyled with new furniture. Breakfast is simply excellent with a great variety of food. I definitvely recommend this hotel also because it's a great bargain, the price are not so high for the great value and quality of this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel but miles from attractions and services.”
Reviews.Author: Postie3226
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good quality, good service and excellent breakfast but besides bus stop across the road little else. 20- 30 minute walk to bus/train terminus, much longer to any well known attractions.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LONDON85KETY
Reviews.Content: i've been in this hotel 1 weeks ago and it's a beautiful hotel confortable , clear and nice. i've been there for 4 days , my son and I . the position of hotel was excellent in five minutes from Via Veneto and just a few feet from a large shopping center. the breakfast was very good and plentiful, I found a lot of food also dietetic I always have problems when I travel because of my allergy to wheat flour but here I had no problems because I found food suitable to my problem. the rooms are clean and offer more services to four star. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would recomend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: sammiemonaghan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited rome in June we had a great time. The hotel was also amazing the room was small but very adequate, as there is that much to see in rome all need is a place to sleep. The room was very clean and the staff where very friendly and at breakfast there was a reasonable good selection to choose from to eat. On our arrivel as check in is'nt till 2pm the hotel held our luggage while we looked about the city as to find where certain things were eg the metro,bus stops etc. The hotel is in a great location as either if you like to walk most sities are relativity close as are the metro and bus stops. I would also like to say a big thank you to the staff at the hotel, aswell as making our stay there very enjoyable. On our arrival home I discovered that I had left my camera and video camera in our hotel room. The staff were very good to me they found my camera's and sent them back. So not only will i have great memories but now have great picture's to share with my family. All down to the reliablity and trust worthily of the staff. So I liks to say a big thank you for making our stay so nice and for returning our camera's . Sam

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stainesy21
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, and well presented, and cleaned every day. we had a king size bed, good TV in the room. The only complaint about the bathroom was the size of the shower, the shower has small shower panels and only two slide open, which only leaves a small space to get into a small shower. Breakfast was excellent, The person who organised the Breakfast did a great job and was very pleasant, We were there in summer time and the breakfast room was a little warm, I suggest they put a couple of fans in the room. The Hotel was in a good quite position. There was a bus stop just out the front of the Hotel. If we travel to Rome again, we would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: annerasmussen2003
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and friendly. You can catch the bus to termini station opposite the hotel, which we found out on our last day! Breakfast good variety and plentiful except for sweet cordial purporting to be orange juice. Rooms small but clean. Street quiet. Wi fi access 2 euros - good value

Reviews.Title: “The service from all the staff especially the concierge & waiter was more than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: ScampyLumps
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I got a double bed.The concierge and chambermaid were very kind to transform it into 2 single beds. They were very helpful and attentive. The Philipino waiter/cook was very cheerful serving everybody. Definitely going back to this hotel. The location is very convenient for Roma Termini. There is a but stop right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain for a central Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: trooper167
Reviews.Content: There is a new wing of the hotel, in a building beside the central one. Although its entrance is quite scary, the rooms are new and well designed. Nevertheless, they are not what you see in the website photo gallery, and seem to be a bit less than those in the main building (but I never got to see the latter). What's more, being secluded in a building other than the one where all the common facilities are situated can be a nuisance, especially given the fact that you weren’t informed accordingly when you made the booking. On the other hand, the price is great compared to what I've paid in the past to stay in central Rome. The hotel may not be at the very heart of the city, but you can walk to piazza di Spagna in 20 minutes' time. As far as the hotel staff is concerned, the evening and night receptionists were really helpfully, in contrast to the day one. In conclusion, I would return mainly based on the very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming and outstanding”
Reviews.Author: RABBITO1
Reviews.Content: My partner booked the hotel for my 'special' birthday. I was a bit concerned when I read some of the poor reviews, but I need not have been so worried. The hotel was lovely, room was small but beautifully decorated and clean. I would agree with previous review , that if you are a light sleeper request a room at the back as the road is busy like any city! The breakfast was great ,big selection to choose from. Staff very friendly, helpful and polite. More than happy and great value. A traditional Italian hotel run by Italians, great base for a break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “loved rome!!”
Reviews.Author: mjspiegel
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days at the Gambrinus Hotel. The staff was friendly spoke good english & very, very helpful. I was always asking for directions & they were very patience with me & explained how to use the buses or how to walk to where I wanted to go. The hotel was spotless & very nicely done! Like most european hotels the rooms are small, but I put our luggage behind the drapes. & the room was fine then. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room in the back. As the strreet can be noisy. Thank you again Hotel Gambrinus for making our stay in Rome perfect!! If you are going to the vatican book your tickets ahead of time otherwise you will be standing on line a long long time!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Irvine92606
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gambrinius for the 1st two nights in Rome. The hotel is about 5 minutes from the train station if you take a cab. The first driver refused to take us and he told us to walk instead (said the hotel is 10 minutes by walking but it is not not true. It's at least a 25-minute walk crossing many busy big streets). Anyway, we found a different taxi and the taxi fare was 4.5 euro. Gambrinius is decorated in a modern style and everything appears newly updated and cheerful. The front desk staff has a warm demeanor and smiled a lot, especially the handsome tall man on duty in the evening (sorry I don't remember his name). Room is decent size and everything is clean and in good working order. Internet works great. Breakfast is good and filling. Breakfast staff very pleasant. Location is good. We booked this hotel because we had a day trip to Naples/Pompeii the next day and the hotel is a pick-up/drop-off location which was very convenient. We had subsequent nights booked at the Marriott Grand Flora on Via Veneto, and we walked there and it took only about 10 minutes and an easy and pleasant walk. Price was fair. We found a good value of about 150 euro including free breakfast and free Internet by booking through Expedia's "unpublished rate" and ended up with Gambrinius. Intially I was a little worried after reading some of negative reviewes but I was pleasantly surprised! We had a pleasant stay at Hotel Gambrinius!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise and great value”
Reviews.Author: Oasis3796
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. When looking at their website I questioned how accurate the images would be in person... The rooms were immaculate, the bathrooms spotless and looked as though recently renovated. The rooms are small yes (where aren't they small in Europe) but absolutely charming and comfortable. As a bonus our window opened up into a pretty courtyard view. The breakfast (which we opted to include in our stay) was really great!! Lots of options (eggs, bacon, cereal, pastries, yogurt etc) and plenty of room to accommodate their guests. The hotel staff all spoke excellent English and happily mapped out all the places we wanted to see. Being from NY, we wanted to walk or use public transportation as much as possible and they were more than well versed in all the bus lines and subway lines. Here are my only caveats... By 4 star don't be fooled into thinking this is a US 4 star. However, for the money, you'd be hard pressed to find something more comfortable and clean. The location may be out of the way for some, so keep that in mind. It is a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and a 10 min walk to Galleria Borghese. It's an easy 5 minute walk to both of the main subway lines that will take you to ancient Rome and the Vatican. Also, note there is free wi fi however it doesn't reach the rooms, you must go down to the lobby or lounge to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EIVISSA
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my 12 year old son after reading positive reviews on Trip Advisor. I just wanted to add to these. The Hotel staff were wonderfully friendly and supremely helpful, both in terms of actual service and also in giving information on bus routes etc. The room I was allocated was small, but par for the course when visiting cities. I've stayed in many 5 star hotels in London where the rooms were even smaller. The bed was comfortable and had fresh sheets each day. The bathroom was newly fitted out and came with complimentary toiletries , plenty of fluffy towels and a hairdryer. The room was very quiet, facing on the side of the hotel. In fact the loudest noise i heard was an owl hooting in the garden next door. Breakfast is taken downstairs and consisted of coffee and juice and a choice of plenty of types of fresh bread, cheeses and meats. Also Yoghurts and a wide selection of cakes and pastries. The location was excellent, just a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. Buses to the Vatican and Colloseum were available just 200 metres away. Bus tickets were available at reception or across the road at the tobacconists.There was an excellent Pizzeria across the road and a selection of other eating places nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel and all its staff. I hope to be back again one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: rosesniffer
Reviews.Content: The Gambrinus priced much lower than other hotels with the same rating. After much deliberation, we decided to stay here. The hotel has what is required, nothing more. Breakfast was adequate, the staff was the one shining spot at this hotel.....they were always friendly and accommodating. Our room was tiny and the bedcovers needed a good cleaning. The bath was fine with a shower, no tub. Free Wifi was great. Our room was quiet and the bed fairly comfortable. For the money, I would stay here again. Hopefully they will get a new cleaning staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Currently_in_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced, reasonably well located hotel in Rome. It does what it promises to do but no more. Rooms are small but clean. The breakfast is a friendly buffet but unfortunately does not vary from day to day. There is a very good and reasonable pizza restaurant across the road. Just to note that this would not be considered a 4 star hotel in most other countries as it has a bare minimum of facilities. That said I have no complaints and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a most memorable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Flikster
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here last year I knew what to expect so I was pleasantly surprised overall. I came last year with my wife but this time I wanted my children (19 and 22) to experience the place (Rome) too. We were put in rooms 215 and 216. Both next to each other with an adjoining sliding door. Rooms were of ampe size and the furnishings and decorations were exquisite. Breakfast was ample (the usual all-you-can-eat-fayre) and set us up for a good day out for each of the three days we were staying there. After asking the receptionist about a local eatery we were pointed in the direction of La Cantinola (turn right out of hotel, then left at the lights and it's on your left) which proved a hit. Sheila and Jennifer loved their peppered steaks. Roberta apparently only works 3 days and I was fortunate enough to see her on the day we left. She is an excellent asset to the hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Thank you again. If you want my advice avoid Il Carcere (where Peter and Paul were imprisoned). For 10 Euros each it's a total waste of money. Maxentius' Circus and Caracalla baths are a must however.

Reviews.Title: “adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: maliandaka
Reviews.Content: had a lovely 4 night stay in rome at this hotel. good location and price. yes, this seems to be the norm in rome but the rooms are miniscule, and on opening the window and shutters, we looked into the courtyard with a bit of a pong so asked to change. we then got a room just as small but at least we looked on to the street, which was very quiet. bed comfy. the hotel was very clean and towels changed daily. there was only staff stairs up, so had to use lift all the time, bit cramped. the desk staff were ok, pleased didn't need to ask too much but , Ruel, the breakfast waiter, was very helpful and chirpy, plenty to eat, tho' everything is served luke warm - specially coffee, that was in every cafe we were in. loved the italian food, prices differ a lot depending how near a tourist spot we were. the pizza restaurant across from the hotel was good and reasonable. Being our first visit, we were blown away by all the roman attractions, most of it easily walked or take the service busses, so easy to hop on and off, there was one right outside the hotel, 5 mins to the main bus/train station then change. the open topped tour bus went from there too. we also had wall to wall sun all the time - in Feb !!!!! There was a bus service from the airport in to main train / bus station, pay at booth just inside airport and wait at stop, ( italians don't know how to queue ). we got a taxi to hotel and were fleeced !!!! should be about 10 euros, we got stung for 25 !! all in all happy with our trip

Reviews.Title: “had a lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: GRACE4393
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed the Roman holiday and the hotel was a part of this. The desk clerk who greeted us was helpful and pleasant and the fellow who organized the very substantial breakfast brought a smile to our faces each morning. Location was convenient and quiet at night. The room and bathroom were both small, but adequate. Internet access was free and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The happiest singing breakfast waiter alive”
Reviews.Author: travelling_syl
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to go to Rome and booked a 7 night stay at this Hotel through Expedia. Location wise, a 10-15 minute walk to main train station. Where u can get bus or metro to the main sites. It's also surrounded by local Restaurants, try out Il Golfo which is round the corner on Via Raffaele Cadorna 24/26. Modern and superb food. Hotel Room is small but sufficient, clean and comfortable. The highlight of our stay was the Phlippino waiter guy who sang every morning in the kitchen. He always gave us a good table and told us fresh batch of bacon has came out. The reception is friendly and answered questions informatively. They helped us phone back the airport transfer people as it was cheaper to use them than normal taxi.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing - not a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: G0East
Reviews.Content: Based on the pictures and hotel rating we expected a standard 4-star place which is not the case in reality. Disappointing rooms (rather small, not very cosy despite some personal touches like paintings matching the interior) and below average breakfast (cold bacon & eggs, poor coffee). We booked the hotel as part of a weekend arrangement so it was fine for this purpose and money spent. Positive experience: friendly and helpful reception staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gambrinus, The right place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Iceman66
Reviews.Content: This is my first review ever and I do it because of other reviews in the last 8 months that criticized the Gambrinus... The hotel has been there for a long while.. It is quaint, clean and friendly. I want to start of with Ms. Roberta who checked us in. This was a charming, outgoing, and extremely helpful person.. She loves her jobs and loves to talk with the guest. Roberta helped us out in so many ways and did it all with a smile... The rooms were small compared to American rooms but then again this is Europe and things are smaller here.. If you want bigger in Rome stay at one of the many Best Westerns that are there but you won't find the Roman atmosphere... They have a small bar and a nice breakfast room that serves a wonderful breakfast of eggs, bacon, mushrooms, different pastries and cake's, fruit, raisins, nuts, rolls, bread, cereals and coffee and juice. Gambrinus is in walking distance to every famous site there is.. Colosseum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Fountain of Trevi, Vatican, Palatine Hill and several others. We loved it so much we are going back in March.... Roger Brisson Morganton, NC

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: deetrevino
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but who cares. You come to Rome to see Rome, not stay in your hotel room. Rooms are clean. Hotel is in the process of being updated. Owners are hands on, helpful. Hotel staff are great. Breakfast is good. Overall a wonderful stay. We will come back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, perfect for Barbie and Ken's dollhouse! Not 4-star!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggal74
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here and whilst we enjoyed Rome, this hotel is definitely not worthy of 4stars. Pictures of this hotel can be a little deceiving...especially the main photo of the hotel facade. The hotel is not located on a corner, if anything it is sandwiched between other buildings/apartments. Having said that, the location is okay in terms of its surroundings. There is a bus stop across the road which we used quite often. We also walked to Via Veneto which was approximately 10-15mins from the hotel. Also, many restaurants and shops are nearby, including a department store. We liked the pizza restaurant across from the hotel...delicious. Upon checking in, we weren't really greeted but we sort of expected that from the previous reviews here. We had to take our own luggage up to the room, and could barely fit two normal sized suitcases in the lift, which also was out of service on one of the days we were there. The room was worse...it was so small that we had to jump over our suitcases to get to the bathroom and to the beds. Even housekeeping could not cope in the room, the maid kept moving our luggage about so she could make the beds and tidy the room. This was very upsetting to us, since we had fragile items and fluids in our suitcases and we did not want them to be moved about or to stand upright. One day, we could not find one of the suitcases and incredulously thought we were robbed. We frantically looked under the bed, in the wardrobe and even in the bathroom (room was so tiny but funnily enough the luggage was nowhere to be seen). We soon found the suitcase standing upright by the window, behind the curtains. I immediately called the front desk to request that our suitcases not be moved again. After calmly explaining the situation, giving my name and room number I was most annoyed when the person said, 'Excuse me, who are you and what is the problem?' I repeated the request and still the person did not understand. We returned the next day to find the suitcases had been moved again! We were prepared for small rooms, but honestly nothing could have prepared me for how tiny the rooms really are at Hotel Gambrinus. We had a twin room which would still be considered small if it was only for one person. Even though the room was tiny, it was very clean and we found the beds to be most comfortable. The breakfast (which was included in our Expedia deal) was very mundane, stale bread, runny eggs, pastries, cold cuts, yoghurt and juice/tea/coffee. The toaster was out of service a few times, so even toast was a luxury! The staff at breakfast though were polite and helpful. Service was so-so, with one exception being the lovely lady at front desk (forgot her name) who helped us with directions as well as booking our taxi transfer to the airport. We went back to her a few times to make changes, and she was always reassuring and helpful. Overall, our hotel experience was average - nothing too spectacular to report. But Rome...was absolutely beautiful! Recommend the Castel Romano Mall for shopping and Trastavere for just a beautiful walk/people watching.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star, would not recommend - we got stolen”
Reviews.Author: Cather7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The third day, my bottle of perfume was missing from our suitcase... We asked the staff if accidently the cleaning lady took it... They said no and did not offer to reimburse us for it. Clearly, it was stolen. The bed was too hard and the breakfast was poor. The walls of the room for damaged and stained as well as the dining room (splashes of coffee on the wall - not pleasant). It is a 15 minute walk to the train station. This is not a 4-star hotel and would not recomment staying there for the value and price...

Reviews.Title: “OK, but...”
Reviews.Author: audiogeek
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Gambrinus for several days. The criteria for choosing it were price and proximity to the rail station. It is a bit of a walk from the station, but doable. The hotel's blurb says free wifi, but like someone else said, only in the lobby, and only for 15-min. You get to pay for anything beyond that. There is wired (pay) service in the room. The room was large enough. We didn't do breakfast, since it was optional, we felt there were better values outside the hotel. It was the bathroom that needs mention. The shower was a corner of the bathroom. There was no shower stall, just a corner of the room with the shower head. A glass partition kept the water from going everywhere, at least until it hit the floor. Note: the shower floor is the bathroom floor; the bathroom floor is the shower floor. Had the bathroom floor had sufficient slope to it, this wouldn't have mattered, but the design of the floor was such that it was level, so the water from the shower, after doing its duty on your body, hits the floor, and flows hither and yon trying to find the drain, which it does, eventually. we used up any spare towels and mats in an attempt to dam the water and direct it to the drain, but the aftermath of showering was that nearly the entire bathroom floor was flooded. Shower == FAIL. The hotel staff was helpful, they spoke English, and there are restaurants a few blocks away. On the Sunday that we arrived, the street that the hotel is located on was nearly deserted. We searched a bit for a restaurant, and found one. Location: distances in Rome are deceiving, and things seem further away than they are. The hotel is "only" about a mile and a half from the Pantheon, and about 2.6 miles (street route, not straight line) from St. Peter's Basilica at the Vatican. Numerically, it seems short, but walking, it seems much longer. Yes, cabs are expensive, and I think it's the initial fare that causes it. It seemed like everything was 10-euros away. Because of Rome's archaeological significance, their Metro is quite limited, not really an option. We never took the bus, we either walked or used cabs. Walking was an adventure, but we saw a lot. Would I stay here again? maybe. It was clean, the room was serviceable. The price was right. The proximity to the train station was good. The website is accurate, however... caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and decent location for the sights”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSwansea_Wales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at Gambrinus. The welcome that we had each day from the staff was excellent and they were only too pleased to help with directions to the sights, advice on dining out, and helping us when I locked us out of our room. The hotel is a 15 minute gentle stroll to the nearest Metro at Piazza Della Republica, but is well placed for slightly longer walks to the sights of Trevi, Pantheon etc. The breakfast at the hotel was very nice and the staff were very cheerful each morning. We ate around the main sights in the daytime, but went to a few restaurants near the hotel in the evening. The area seemed safe and we were out until 11.00ish and felt quite comfortable. This was my third time in Rome and my Partner's first, and we would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: wphillips11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for value and location. 20 minute walk to train station and hop on, hop off buses. The staff speak excellent English and will help with booking tours and arranging transportation. The rooms are clean, and have all the amenities including safe, fridge, iron & board. Ice, water, soda and wine are available. There are quite a few cafes, bars and a pharmacy within a 2 block radius. The location felt very safe to us...lots of people and well lit. All the staff were very accomodating but I have to particularly mention Giuseppe and Roberta as being most helpful and friendly. They definitely made us feel "at home". Wendy Phillips & Earl Skerritt....Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 4 stars - would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Debolula
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gambrinus for 3 nights in September 2010 as part of our tour around Italy. The Gambrinus was by far the worst hotel we stayed at. Generally I expect to pay over the odds for hotels in big cities but given that this hotel was 4 star it no where near lived up to expectations. We booked a twin room for the 3 nights which wasn't available when we arrived due to a 'problem with the water'. We were put in 2 single rooms in the hotel which were next to each other. One of the rooms was barely big enough to fit a single bed (the porter even made a joke about this) but I didn't mind too much as it was only for one night and there was no extra charge. However, the next morning when we went down to breakfast we were met with a damp cellar which had mould growing up the walls. The cereal I had was stale, there was no fresh juice or tea or coffee only a hot drink machine. The rest of the breakfast did not look particularly appertising either. The second night we were moved to our twin room which was not in the hotel, but in an appartment block down the street. It did not feel particularly comfortable being outside of the hotel and the bathroom window was broken. The staff on the in the hotel, (with the exception of when we checked in) were not particularly friendly or keen to help. The hotel provided 15 mins free wifi and then you had to pay for it but it only worked in the reception area. I don't know how this hotel has been given 4 stars - we stayed in three other hotels in Italy which were of a much higher quality, one of which was 3 stars. Location wise it is a little way out from the sites but reasonably accessable if you use buses. I would recommend staying closer to the trevi fountain/spanish steps area for a much better Rome experience. Whilst I still enjoyed my visit to Rome, The hotel did ruin it slightly for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: katy2808
Reviews.Content: We recently visited this hotel and had a really nice time. The rooms are clean and have a tranquil, Italian feel to them. The bed was comfortable and there is a safe in the room to store valuables. There was a bit of noise from the street at night but it was fine if you had the windows shut. The location of the hotel is good and most of the attractions are within walking distance. You are only 20 minutes away from the Spanish steps. However, if you don't want to walk there is a bus stop close-by that takes you to the attractions for only 1 euro each. Breakfast at the hotel was surprisingly good with cereals, breads, pastries and bacon and eggs every morning. On the last day our flight was late in the evening and the hotel looked after our luggage for us after we had checked out so we could spend our last day sight-seeing. Overall, a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tb7777
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel with friendly staff, we had a family room (2 rooms with interconnecting door) which meant we had 2 bathrooms which was very handy with teenagers. Staff friendly and helpful, told us the best way of getting around and showed us routes to different places on local maps. Breakfast was nice with range of cooked and continental (cheeses, hams, breads etc try the A.C.E juice was gorgeous) and lovely pastries the round doughnuts were particularly delicious. It is a little further out than other hotels but was only about 15/20 mins walk from the Station Termini. The closest attraction is the villa borgese with beautiful gardens and it's not far from the zoo. The Spanish steps are about a 20 mins walk away so if you don't mind strolling through the lovely streets of Rome this is definitely a good place to stay. It was a lovely quiet area too away from noisy bars and clubs etc so ideal for families. There are lovely restaurants all round the area with a super Pizzeria just across the road serving a massive pizza for 4 people, really has to be seen to be believed. All in all a good holiday had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Not, by anyone's definition, a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Owl_86
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay in Rome, having booked this hotel at quite a heavy discount via Expedia. With that in mind, it wasn't a bad deal. However, if I had paid full price I would have been horrified at the quality of an Italian 'four star' hotel. The room we received was very small, although the bathroom made it look positively spacious - there wasn't room to swing a cat in the bathroom, there was hardly anywhere to keep our toiletries and there was no ventilation for when we were using the shower. It's also worth noting that if either myself or my partner was on the large side, we wouldn't have even fit in the tiny shower cubicle. The room itself was what I would consider to be average three star quality. Everything in it worked, but there were small irritations such as there only being four hangers in the wardrobe. The walls were fabric covered rather than wallpapered or painted, and there were various stains on the fabric that made the room look dirty. We chose not to eat breakfast in the hotel as it was quite expensive, instead venturing out early in the mornings before it got too hot. The location of the hotel wasn't great in terms of nearby amenities, but it is very well-served by buses, which are much better value than the Metro and cover a much wider area. The bus stop immediately opposite the hotel has a number of buses which serve Termini station (much better than taking a taxi - taxi drivers in Rome WILL rip you off if you're a tourist), whilst the main road around the corner has a number of buses which go to the main sightseeing areas, including Vatican City. A single fare is 1 euro, and 4 euros will get you an unlimited day pass. Overall, this hotel was fine for the price I paid and the limited amount of time I spent there, but it was a reflection to me of Italian hotel standards - nowhere else in Europe would this pass as a four star hotel. If you genuinely want four star quality, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Tiny Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JanGov
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable as the room was v tiny n the bathroom tinier...Not suitable if u are traveling with kids otherwise decent in terms of the assistance offered by the reception...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, that went out of it's way to make a wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: LazarusHeart
Reviews.Content: Gambrinus is a great hotel to stay at in Rome. Whilst situated slightly out of the hustle and bustle of the centre, it is well placed for buses acoross the city to all of the major landmarks (including Trevi, Colosseum, Vatican etc). There are a few restaurants located around the hotel, providing excellent quality food - can highly recommend the pizzeria directly opposite! For those that like to end the night on a cocktail there are a few convenient bars within a few minutes walk. The Hotel Receptionist (Roberta???) greeted us on arrival and supplied us with a really helpful map - on which she marked the main tourist locations and details of the best ways to get there, including bus numbers, times etc etc. This proved to be the single most useful thing in the whole trip. The room was well presented, beautifully decorated and impeccably clean. It was cleaned daily, with fresh linen and fresh towels. A fridge inside the room held complimentary bottles of water and in-room coffee/tea facilities were well received (although they could do with supplying more coffee and coffee whitener!!). Breakfast was simply fabulous, a great selection of both hot and cold foods. The hotel was well staffed with friendly faces, all of whom went out of heir way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I really can' recommend this hotel highly enough - and can only agree with other reviewers that Roberta is an absolute asset to any experience of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: andyingb99
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a great long weekend in Rome staying at the Gambrinus Hotel. The rooms were of good size, clean and very well presented. For a European (from my experience) hotel it was great to have Tea/Coffee facilities included, iron/ironing board and electronic safe. The morning breakfast which was included in our rate was just what you wanted. Cereals, toast, croissants/pastries, fruit, yoghurt and hot trays of egg/bacon etc. We didn’t use the bus network in Rome, but there is a bus stop right out side (Not sure where they went though). The hotel is 10-12 minutes walk from the TERMINI. But we reckoned the nearest metro station was Repubblica which also about 10 minutes away and is a pleasant walk. It’s also felt perfectly safe walking late the evening walking back at 11pm. If you want a good hotel in a non touristy area of the city then this is the place to stay. There are also lots of small great places to eat within 3-4 minutes walk of the hotel. We especially liked some of the small restaurants down Via Bergamo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice room, Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: 2010mainer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel.The location was very good,not too far from the main train station.We used the hop on and off tour buses to see the sights and we used the local buses too and they worked well. Hotel staff was pretty friendly. They showed us how to get around and helped with taxis etc. Roberta was not on duty much when we were there. The breakfast was good and the breakfast staff was very friendly. The bathroom was clean but did have a funky odor in the morning, they said it maybe was from work being done outside the hotel. The air conditioning worked very well and Rome was very hot when we were there. The beds were comfortable. The electricity had to be turned on with our room key when you entered the room but that was not a problem. Wireless internet did not work in our room on the third floor so we had to sit in the breakfast room or lobby area to get a signal. My daughter and I would stay there again if we are able to visit Rome again. We enjoyed the hotel especially for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdelrioc
Reviews.Content: Excelent as B&B. Staff are very kind and willing to solve any situation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvellous!”
Reviews.Author: jules_tokyo
Reviews.Content: i was staying at the hotel for the night because i was going to catch an early train to the north of italy early in the morning. the hotel is greatly located, only ten mins walking to termini station. my room was lovely, very clean and with cable/pay per view tv. bathroom very spacious.i am a smoker so i asked for a smoking room, ive been to hotels where you could still smell the smoke in the room, but this time the room smelt clean and fresh. free magazines about what to do and what to visit in rome were in the room. staff was very helpful and friendly. the bed was very very confy. staff also provided me with a map to reach termini station (although its only ten mins away and super easy to reach!). will definitely recommend it to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Roberta - Give this lady a raise!!”
Reviews.Author: Great_Expectations84
Reviews.Content: Good- Staff, location and cleanliness. Bad - Beds and smell. First of all; the concierge extraordinaire Roberta is sensational! Talk about going above and beyond.. Very well kept classic style hotel centrally located about 20-40 minutes walk to all tourist attractions. Room was funky and pink with very strong lemon odour (covering up... cigarette smoke? Note sure!) that gave me a headache. Our colleagues room did not smell at all. Bathroom was clean and public bathroom off breakfast room was the cleanest I saw in all of Italy. Breakfast was OK. DO NOT stay here if you need a firm bed, This was horrible for me and I was so cranky by the time we left. To the hotel: Please invest in new beds now as they are way too soft and lumpy! Please invest in Roberta as well; she will take the reputation of this place far and we will remember her for a long time, Thank you again Roberta!

Reviews.Title: “great value, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: amalfipostman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gambrinus Hotel at the beginning and at the end of our trip and would stay here again on our next trip to Rome. The location is very convenient. Close enough to the train station to walk, yet away from the push of the tourist areas.. We walked easily everywhere but also enjoyed the neighbourhood feel around the hotel where we found some fabulous places for coffee, deli, wine or dining that were more of the local fare than touristy. Everyone friendly and welcoming! The hotel was clean, comfortable and quaint. The rooms were better than most we have experienced in Italy and the staff were very good to us. Make sure to opt for the breakfast as it is well worth the money. The woman who works in the breakfast room is fabulous: cheery, funny and a wealth of knowledge. We (4 of us) used the hotel-airport service and found it to be an added bonus. The Borghese gardens are a short walk away and shouldn't be missed on a sunny day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: JeanPaulGToronto
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating in changing original online reservations; received welcome email from concierge Roberta, which was appreciated; no problem checking-in; professional, courteous and helpful staff; first room was very small but got a larger one when we returned 12 days later; good breakfast; quite a few restaurants in area, including across the street; good location and felt safe at all times. Windows do open for fresh air and no noise at all at night! Congratulations and thank you to concierge Roberta and all the staff

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Pupita53
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from my stay at gambrinus Hotel which is a 4 star european hotel (or so they say). the hotel is far from the main attractions but walking distance rom the bus stop and half an hour wlaking from the nearest subway station. The staff is ok except for roperta who is very friendly, nice , helpful and extremely patiente with the guests (opposite from the others who are not friendly at all!) The room 411 is well located , facing the street, but very quiet. The bathroom is ridiculous small and can only be used by very slim people (which is not my case). the breakfast is ok but the quality of the products... Most of the rooms are in the main building , but the hotel has a floor of contemporary rooms at the building next door with no communication to the main building. I was supposed to stay in the new rooms but the entrance is scary!!! if you are looking for a 4 star hotel forget about this one, but if you are ok with a 3 star european style hotel, then you are going to have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Location, amenities, assistance, and breakfasts -- all excellent.”
Reviews.Author: gwenwrite
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gambrinus is a four-star hotel, centrally located, with comfortable rooms, helpful staff with good English, computer access, and fine breakfasts. Hostess Roberta was enormously helpful and thoroughly proficient in Engllish.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best buy for the money but not a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MauiLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days and then returned for our last day before flying home. The staff was extremely friendly, kind and helpful, especially Roberta Landoni. She went out of her way to accomadate our needs. I would not classify this as a 4 star hotel because there are amentities not available in this property such as valet parking, there is no parking lot. There is a lovely breakfast area in the downstairs which serves every morning if you purchase this option. The business center consists of 2 computers that barely work with no printers also in the breakfast area. The staff did provide me the use of the hotel printer. The in-room internet didn't work. The hotel offers 15 minutes free use of the internet then anything after that you must purchase. The rooms are quite small. The wall coverings are fabric and may have holes in them. A section of the baseboard in our room was not fixed to the wall. The showers are very small. If you are a person of larger stature it can be very tight. Some mornings we had no hot water. The room service is not in-house prepared.. There are several outside restaurants which provide the food. I would recommend this hotel but would advise of the little quirks it has.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, clean rooms and bathrooms, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: JRHK
Reviews.Content: I read through a lot of reviews for hotels in Rome before choosing Gambrinus. Prior to this trip, I had stayed at Hotel Exedra, a 5 star hotel. Gambrinus actually fared well in comparison. The staff were very well informed and professional. THe hotel though small is well managed. The breakfast lacked little and was the best we had among the other 3-4 star hotels we had in Florence, Como (Bellagio). All in all, I was very happy with the hotel Gambrinus and would definitely recommend it to picky travelers who appreciate good value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad for the location”
Reviews.Author: pbkb_67
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome. Stayed a week. Loved the location, just two block walk to catch bus 62 to Vatican, or 60 to Colleseum (or anywhere inbetween). Felt very safe in this neighborhood and there were plenty of places to eat. Our room was large, although peeking in some of the doors we could see others were not as fortunate. Front desk staff was not always friendly, although Mr. Gil and Miss Roberta spoke excellent English and were always willing to offer advice. Rooms were clean. Breakfast more than was expected. Internet slow, but free in the cafe (don't use the service in the room it's not worth the 6E). On the downside, we ran out of hot water on three different days. When we called the front desk the man was quite rude. There was construction going on which woke us up at 8am several mornings (chisels and hammers). On Saturday night, there were teenagers making all kinds of loud noise (possibly from adjacent apartments). Twice we heard noises that sounded like gunshots but we finally decided it was the recycling dumpsters being replaced. (Front desk did not answer when we tried to reach them for an explanation.) And finally, be sure to ask for a room with a view. We ended up with one of the rooms mentioned in previous reviews that overlooked the grungy courtyard. We never took the time to ask to be moved as we were never there during the day. We decided we would probably stay here again, just for the location and the "local charm". But then we're those crazy Americans. :) If you need airport or cruise transpotation we highly recommend Marco Marco of Italycab. They were excellent and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Less is more... :)”
Reviews.Author: Cristina0
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the staff...they were very kind and friendly.. Otherwise it is not a 4 star hotel, more like 2 1/2 maybe 3, a little bit far from Termini, small bathroom, strange smell in the room and noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “good clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dixwimby
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel near villa borghese park and close enough to walk to spanish steps, but long enough to enjoy. had a single room. without being too expensive. spotlessly clean room, teas made. breakfast in the basement was the usual continental fair, breads, rolls, meats cheeses jams, scrambled eggs, thin bacon, cereals, coffee, various teas. if your looking for a lavish feast well presented it is not. but again more than adequate. staff are friendly and will give information in a number of languages. good hotel for under 90 euro. There are plenty of restaurants in the area the best Val di Sangro in via alessandra about 170 metres from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hildekd
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Hotel Gambriuns in the end of March. Location is good in relation to rail and sights - all within walking distance. The rooms are small but nice and clean, some traffic noise if you have a room facing Via Piave, good breakfast, friendly staff, and reasonable prices. We would like to stay here the next time we`re going to Rome. Hilde, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Ensure you Know what you want”
Reviews.Author: ebass
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as a 4 star but I would not rate it above 3. The hotel was very basic with no facilities. I had room and breakfast. The breakfast was typical Italian which was fine but the breakfast room was cramped. The staff are very friendly. I would consider this an hotel where all you want to get out of it was a place to put your head at night. It does not have a restaurant, bar or a lounge to relax. When you come into the hotel it's your room and nothing else. The positives are that its relatively cheap for Rome, I bought it through last minute.com and its location is within 10-20 minutes of all the major attractions. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and there is large park within 10 min walk, ideal for a run. If you want style don't come here, if you want a basic hotel and the price/location suits then it's clean and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean central hotel, with lots of transportation posibilitites to all the famous sights”
Reviews.Author: sisCph
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my old mother, who is not walking that well, and by luck, this hotel was near perfect, because of all the different busses stopping close by, and a super restaurant just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are very warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Holidays1612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during April. There were 4 of us, so we booked the family room which consists of two separate rooms connected by a hallway. It was very spacious. The staff (especially) Roberta made our stay very welcoming. She was extremely friendly and did her upmost to make our stay extremely comfortable. Breakfast was lovely with bacon, eggs, cereal, yoghurt, toast, coffee, juices and pastries. If i were to return to Rome, i would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “quite good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aira828
Reviews.Content: quite acceptable hotel but not excellent breakfast. Visit it if you don't expect something more than average
