Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in handy location with easy access to all Rome has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBluenose
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old daughter to celebrate the fact that she was 13 for a couple of days. I booked direct with the hotel having searched on many sites including lastminute.com. I received a welcome email after booking and Roberta (who was as nice in person as she was via email) was able to confirm my preference for a twin room. The hotel was easy to find. It is a decent hotel in a nice area. Breakfast was plentiful and of decent quality. The room itself was good and really good value for the price with a lounge, bedroom and en-suite. The shower was more a dribble than a shower, that was the only fault with the room. I would receommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome, 2 nights for two people - 155 Euros was good value. An added bonus is that there is a really nice restaurant over the road where we ate both nights, the food was lovely as was the service and it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “probably the best place to begin a wonderful day in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Russeren
Reviews.Content: Roberta in the breakfast room provides a very warm welcoming to the small family of three. The atmsphere is informal ,the staff is competent, descreet and efficient. The room was smal, bu it offered the services we needed,: Iron, hairdryer, television, refrigerator, bidet and a hot shower. Gambrinus is located not to close to center in a quiet nighbourhood, in walking distance to the central station, the bus stop is right acros the street. It is easy to get to the Gambinus. I had visit the Gambrinus thirty years ago, then it was quite different, to day it is a class hotel, though I miss to coocking, there is no dinner at the hotel as far as I know. But fortunatelye close by is one or two very good restaurants I recoment La Cantinola

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: SharifromMtAiry
Reviews.Content: Great value, clean. Excellent choice. Right across the street from the bus stop that goes to Roma Terminii. Makes it very easy to get around the city. Located in a business neighborhood, good restaurants nearby. Safe. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable about transportation, attractions, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay for a short time”
Reviews.Author: Flikster
Reviews.Content: Room 205. 3 nights stay 15-18 Feb 2010. Room was a tad small. Imagine a quarilateral with opposite sides 3.5m and narrowing 2.5 metres, there was little space for more than a bed. Needed a bit more storage areas but didn't need much as we were only there 3 nights. The decor was somewhat mesmeric in nature but was clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the female maitre d who gave me some chocolates for being so happy when we left. In conclusion I'd say that this was a nice place to stay FOR A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME. I think the issue of room size would become more apparent after a week or so. It would have been nice to have had a suitable stair access too as the lift was a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikespalla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the city center , it is walking distance to everything. I appreciated the warm welcome, and the helpfulness and friendliness of the outstanding hotel staff. A delicious breakfast is included, and each morning it was a lovely start to the day. I especially loved the capuccino, made exactly to my taste. The room was small, but big enough for the two of us, and immaculate. There was a computer available, and I never had to wait to use it. I book the hotel on the Home page and I got a very good deal.I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value but little heat in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca194
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights last week with my sister. Uncertain about what to expect, enjoyed our stay overall. Pros: staff mostly cordial. Roberta was the best, sweet and helpful. Rooms typically small, but neat & clean. Shower not excessively small as described by others. Residential location satisfactory, safe and we blended in well. As native New Yorkers, we felt paranoid & somewhat disturbed about how aggressively tourists can be targeted in high profile areas, exercise caution & awareness. The hotel was gratefully well lit and locked at night. Breakfast coffee was good, food ok. Cons: Rooms cold. Heat turns on approx 11 pm, shuts off 2 am, making the morning shower rather uncomfortable. Lastly, checkout annoying, concierge insisted belligerently that we used minibar and wanted to charge us. We didn't, but left bad taste, very petty and their fault for not monitoring this properly. Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: SergioRU
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. Convenient for transport. Quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: godfatheross
Reviews.Content: Very hospital, especially Roberta! Quiet rooms and good beds to sleep. Extensive breakfast and discount on shuttle bus from airport Fuimicino. Certainly value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gambrinus Illegally Charged my Credit Card!”
Reviews.Author: NCamp79
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay at the Hotel Gambrinus in Rome, Italy! They illegally charged my credit card almost $1,000 for a reservation that was cancelled months in advance. After repeated attempts to get in touch with them, the hotel manager contacted me and said that they would credit my account. It was never credited and they stopped returning phone calls and emails. It is so disappointing that this happened and that the manager of the hotel would have the nerve to email me and explictly say that he would credit my account. It is illegal and wrong. I have had to hire an attorney and I truly hope if you are considering staying at this hotel, you'll remember this experience. Hotel Gambrinus [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nice small rooms, Internet acess poor, Not great location”
Reviews.Author: Q3years
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a Virgin Vacation package. The walk from the train is about 0.8 miles and to nearest metro is just about 0.6 miles. Area is safe, well lit. Front desk staff were not friendly or particularly helpful. Internet in room is 10 euros and didn't work. The only time that the "free" internet on the hotels computer seemed to be working was during breakfast when there was a sign posted that the internet could not be used until 11AM. Rooms were small, clean and well kept.Bathroom very small as expected. Breakfast was fine. Overall,I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Gambrinus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solvinyuu
Reviews.Content: in my second stay I Stayed 2 nights at the gambrinus Hotel and was not disappointed. Hotel staff friendly. Room very good and and very clean , Breakfast excellent. . Internet should be free these days and why no English papers. Many attractions were within walking distance (Trevi fountain, Spanish steps). It was very close to the subway. The staff was very helpful and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roygutierrez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gambrinus last year and thought it was great, this year was even better. . The bedroom and bathroom were large and decorated to a high standard. the hotel is ideally placed in a quite road within 10 minutes from the Via Venetto and the fabulous Villa Borghese . Breakfast was a buffet style with plenty of choice and it kept you going all day. The staff were both helpful and courteous Next time we visit Rome we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very go for a city break”
Reviews.Author: crlosmendoza
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Italy for our honeymoon and while the whole trip was a dream, Roberta and the rest of the staff were so kind and helpful. They even arranged museum visit times for us before we even arrived! The room was lovely, quiet and charming - perfect size and great use of space. The shower was a bit small, but fine. The hotel offers free internet access on a computer in the lobby, which was very helpful. The breakfast was nice, with a variety of choices. They also offer a happy hour drink and snacks in the afternoon - a welcomed treat after a day of sightseeing,the location is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Very clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerkelfrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week in this hotel , the location is very good just and near all main transportation , the room was very clean an confirtable with all ammenities and also a coffe maker it was very nice decorated, the breakfast was also very good. in front of the hotel there is a very good pizzeria and arround the corner a nice trattoria .

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsueToronto
Reviews.Content: Arrived early off a Mediterranean Cruise and the room was not ready. The front desk staff was helpful. Upon arrival at our room from a tiny elevator we were disappointed. It certainly did not meet our expectations. The room was very small with very little space for clothes. It was difficult for two people to move around had to climb over the bed and each other. However, our biggest shock was the washroom. The shower was impossible. The smallest I've ever seen. As for the breakfast in the basement very old fashioned dining room we ,after a few bites, chose to pass. We went down the street to a cafe for our morning pastry and cappuccino. I don't know who gave this a four star rating but they need glasses. We also stayed at hotels in Florence, Venice and Milan which were truly four star hotels. It put a damper on our trip to Rome and we couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Traveller999900
Reviews.Content: The hotel suited us well. It was convenient for the station and the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain area of Rome. It was comfortable, clean and quiet, despite being full. The breakfast was good. If you want a big bathroom, perhaps it is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Central but still convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Capobob
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 day break in Rome and kind of just stumbled across the Gambrinus on the web....booked a flight and all of a sudden we were in Rome.... The Gambrinus is Very close to Porta Pia making navigation to and from easy...nothing is more than a 30 min Bus or Metro ride away and some Famous sights (Spanish Steps and Trevi are within walking distance...not close by..but manageable. The major stuff , like The Colloseum and Vatican are on the other side of Rome but the Metro station is close enough and Buses are plentiful. Overall we were happy with the Hotel as a base for our trip...but the Breakfast room was busy and choice was limited, unfortunately the coffee machine broke during our stay as well and the Juice machine ran out of Fresh juice...! Our room was on the corner of the Hotel and was therefore wedge shaped, but the air conditioning just managed to keep the room cool during the Hottest days of this Summer. The Bathroom was snug but adequate, everywhere was clean. The Staff were pleasant and all the Concierge we met were helpfull and knowledgeable. I would recommend this Hotel if you are on a budget and are willing and able to walk a fair bit!

Reviews.Title: “They cheated us on the price”
Reviews.Author: kdrakoul
Reviews.Content: We have booked 2 rooms over the internet and, although the hotel acknowledged & confirmed our advance reservation, when we arrived they didn't have any record of our names. Instead, they told us that only the suite was available (at 1am!). Despite us showing them proof of our reservation later, they even declined to refund us back!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: mskatie1959
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at. Nothing around it opens in August. It is like a ghost town, a unsafe slum ghost town. One taxi driver refused to take me to the area. All buildings are roller shuttered and covered in graffiti that looks like it has been there as long as The Collosseum with no attempt to clean up the area. Hotel looks nothing like any of it's pictures. Room was size of cupboard and tacky. TV wasn't watchable. Fridge didn't work. Took 2 complaints & 2 days to have it looked at and replacement didn't work any better. So I couldn't have a cold drink in my room, hotel bar was never staffed and there are no pubs nearby, all this during a heatwave, 40 degrees everyday. I needed cold drinks Even if the fridge had worked they charge 20 Euros a day if you put any of your own food or drink in it. Never seen that at a hotel in 40 years of travelling.....what a nerve. No bath. Basic toiletries. Breakfast was cold everyday, cold greasy eggs, bacon and indistinguishable other things. They are supposed to serve breakfast 7 -10 but stop a 9am. Staff are rude.There was never anyone on Reception Desk to greet guests and when someone did emerge from a back room they were extremely rude. Rome is horrid, this hotel is disgusting. Never stay there. You can't walk anywhere because the area is dark, vacant and eerily dangerous. You can get a bus regularly to Termini from opposite the hotel, but finding right bus back is not easy so you always need a taxi. Rome taxi drivers rip you off, same trip can cost 6-15 Euros depending on which taxi driver you get. I travelled Europe on my own for an extended period, only feared for my safety in Via Piave coming and going from Hotel Gambrinus. DO NOT STAY THERE. I made complaints in writing to Manager, got no response. They don't care. Basil Fawlty runs a better hotel than this. Management does't even care it's bad.

Reviews.Title: “Small 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelfastDuffer
Reviews.Content: Small but friendly 3* Hotel about 15 mins walk from the spainish steps Trevi fountain etc. Good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanie654
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the staff were extremely helpful and spoke very good english. rooms were very smart, bathroom, even though slightly dated was adequate, with plenty of hot water. Hotel was in a very good position, only a few hundred meters from bus stops to all major attractions. Very good restaurants in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are over 130lbs..”
Reviews.Author: mailman33
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice once you step into the lobby. The front desk attendant is very courteous and helpful. Once we stepped into the room, it became a sauna. I complained several times while we stayed there, but they kept telling me it takes some time to cool. At 3am, I decided to sleep in the lobby where the temperature was very cool. The next day I told the front desk it was unacceptible and asked for a refund unless they could provide me another room. They obliged and the new room was a little cooler. I'm from Houston,Tx and used to heat, but I could not stand the heat in these rooms. Another negative part of the visit was the small showers. I couldn't walk in or out without rubbing my body against the shower doors (disgusting). Also, they would not let you use the internet service until 11am, well after many of the tours begin. How helpful is that?? The best part of the hotel was their complimentary breakfast! They also had very friendly porterers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here?...You must be joking!”
Reviews.Author: anmackay
Reviews.Content: The only way to make a reservation at this Hotel would be to walk in to the reception and ask if they had any rooms available!....if you book it with any Internet Booking agency you will most likely arrive at the Hotel and be told "Sorry, we do not appear to have your booking" After consulting TripAdvisor prior to making my journey but after making an online booking, I even contacted the Hotel directly to see if they had a confirmed booking. Their email duly stated that a room was booked for 3 nights and I was arriving late so I set off fully expecting no problems when I arrived. No prizes for guesing what happened next! They tried to fob me off with a sister Hotel down the road at 10 in the evening (Baileys Hotel, mentioned in other reviews)after arriving on a late flight......Oh no you're not says I......after about an hour coming and going on the telephone to various managers I was finally given a room, but not before a considerable amount of distress was experienced by myself and my wife. If you havn't got a strong personality and feel confident about coping with a situation such as this don't book this Hotel...but then again, even if you have, why would you want to go through this scenario when their are 100's of other Hotels in Rome which won't give you this hassle!!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION GOOD GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: not124get
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel 10th -14th May. While rooms were small this was a minor details. B/Fast was OK would agree with the coffee machines. What we found fantastic was we had two elderly ladies with us and 'walking' around rome was not practicle, the hotel organised our taxi on the first morning to the Vatican city, the taxi driver was very nice and gave us his card. The next day we asked the reception to contact the taxi co as we were keen to hire them for a tour - we got two hours in a mini bus for only 60.00 euros unbelievable value. We hired him again the next day for another tour - thanks Carlos for a great time. The staff were very nice, would defo re book and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but a bit out of town”
Reviews.Author: Avatar1
Reviews.Content: Probably the friendliest people we met in Rome! Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Room a bit small but shower rediculously small - gap to get in no more than 20 inches! On a busy road, would have kept the window open for fresh air but too noisy even at night. Hotel was described as 500 metres from Termini station - more like a mile. Nearest metro Republicca which is about 15 mins walk. We paid for 'high speed internet' using the room keyboard and TV - don't bother, connection so slow we gave up. Very clean room, just a bit small, not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from the center of Rome - incident at hotel made it worse”
Reviews.Author: linrich21
Reviews.Content: Before going, we knew this hotel was farther out that we had wanted, but let our relatives do the booking. There were issues with the booking process that the hotel told us to "work out between us". We were trying to reserve a room by each couple, but they charged our card with the whole amount. The rooms were on the small side, and even though they advertise airconditioning - it was not on. The option was to hear the loud traffic all night or bear the uncomfortable sleeping temperature in the room. There was not a coffee maker in our room (our traveling companions received one two days into the trip), but it was not a problem - because we were always up early to enjoy the breakfast downstairs. The breakfast presentation and personnel were very good. The front desk personnel were helpful most of the time -sometimes there was noone who spoke english, but understandable. The worst thing that happened - and really soured us on this hotel and its ethics was when our traveling companions returned from their cruise to stay another night (we had already left for home a week earlier), and they were told by the front desk that we had stolen their coffee pot from the room!!! This is unexcusable, and ridiculous... why would anyone from the states want their plastic coffee pot with the foreign adapter!!!! Not to mention the terrible feeling of being accused of such a thing. What a terrible taste this left for us - having been labeled as a "thieves!" We would never take anything that was not ours, and resent very much the distasteful way this happened. Perhaps the hotel would be well-served to check their own employees, or have a better system of accounting when each guest checks out. If anyone should choose to stay at this hotel, I would make sure that you actually have a coffeemaker - or anything else that was supposed to be included in your room, so that it is not left up to the hotel staff to accuse you! Aside from this, which was apparently very hurtful - we loved Rome. I have been there numerous times, and was anxious to show my husband and relatives all that it has to offer. Just be warned, if you stay at the Gambrinus. I would suggest staying near to the heart of the old city, so that you can walk to most of the attractions. The high speed internet, located near the breakfast room, was down most of the time we were there. The restaurant was not open on two of the nights we tried to dine there.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 10 minutes brisk walk from just about any major landmark, the staff is extremely friendly, the management must be proud of their team. Clean, welcoming and bright, it only has two failings, one is the size of the bathroom, which is much too small and the other is the breakfast: coffee machine makes excellent espresso, but no fruits and vegetables at all, no vegetarian items, I felt sorry for two Asian ladies, that were looking hungry over the choice. We had a bottle of wine with compliments as a welcome and I liked the special offer of 25 EUR per night that includes wi-fi internet and all TV channels. Not that someone would visit Rome and will stay in their room to take advantage of it. There is a free internet on a small workstation right down to the bar, but only works 11 am to 11 pm. The windows isolate the street noise perfectly. Bottom line is, I will visit it again, if I am on a tight budget. Italy is beautiful, but doesn't come cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good locatrion and modest price”
Reviews.Author: elvispotter555
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Quite clean and modest price. Conveniently located near the attractions and safe. I stayed here for 4 nights. The staff were very helpful and spoke reasonably good English. However, the shower was small for a 4 star hotel. The double room was not very big but reasonable I ask for a superior room but the were all booked . The breakfast was very good with eggs and bacon and other I am glad because I had a peaceful stay

Reviews.Title: “mmmmm..it's ok..but look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MrnMrsMouse
Reviews.Content: All hotel reviews are based on previous hotel experience and standards that you personally expect. I earn an average wage and expect a clean, well presented/decorated room that is big enough to swing a cat with helpful, courteous staff. I booked this through a v well known UK website advertising as their most popular 4 star hotel in Rome for a romantic getaway. If you read no further then it ticks the above requirements...just...but does not set the world alight. Look elsewhere in my opinion. Why? Well, it is not really centrally located. If you want to walk around the city. Then prepare to WALK. It takes 40 to 50 minutes to walk from/to the colleseum or Vatican. The room was clean but the carpets in the hallway were dirty throughout stay. Breakfast was passable. BASIC staff helpfulness should start, at the very least with your bags being taken to your room and being shown where it is. NOT being asked to take your bags into a room up the stairs while your room is prepared upon arrival. Air conditioning did not work. Shower was very small. Room size was small/ok and decor was good but this was not our original room. Upon first arriving we went to our original room to find that it had not been cleaned and I was NOT impressed with the decor. Luckily our second room was passable so they avoided an angry client. Incidentally when I was walking in the hall I heard another person asking to change rooms because he did not like it. I did not hear the full reason. That said we had a pleasant stay. If I were to return I would definately pay a little extra to stay more centrally but if you do stay here...well...what can I say...'its just ok'.! If you're looking for a romantic weekend at a hotel with a little romantic vibe then look elsewhere. Would I recommend.....well in the absence of a 'not sure' then I vote probably not. Its a 3 possibly 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “a dream vacation come true, thanks to Gambrinus hotel”
Reviews.Author: juegagirl
Reviews.Content: My family and I recommend this hotel highly. The attention to detail was amazing, very family oriented and warm. The hotel itself was immaculate and up to date with all the modern amenities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to rome. It is centrally located in the heart of all the tourist attractions that you don't want to miss out on. rome was amazing and gambrinus hotel just added to the experience of a perfect vacation. to all the staff of gambrinus we would love to thank you for making our stay with you extra special.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: msundersson
Reviews.Content: It was newly remodeled. The rooms were beautiful and super clean. There was internet connection in the room . The breakfast was excellent. The hotel staff was so pleasant and offered a drink upon check-in. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and am looking forward to my return visit. Downtown Rome is 10/ minutes away. Super great price for a city break stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0b99
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel with English-speaking staff that is walkable from the train station. The room was standard but very comfortable. The breakfast, which is included with the room, was fantastic. The frontside restaurant is also very good - one of the best pizzas we had in 2 weeks in Italy - seriously. . Apparently it is easy to take the bus into downtown, and the bus stop is right next door, but we really preferred to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gambrinus =Spoiled Rome Memories.”
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 1/2 star hotel in Rome through Hotwire. Paid $790. C. for three nights. The best part of this hotel is the beautiful white marble lobby, cool and well air conditioned. The rest is like a Twilight Zone story. Take the tiny elevator to your floor and you step out into into a damp and overly warm hallway. Enter your room and you're met with an offensive smell in the air. The walls are completely covered in a plumped up fabric which give off a musty odour. Entering the bathroom and you are greeted with a very pungent and off-putting mould smell. The sleeping room is very warm and humid. The air conditioner is on at its coolest setting but there is only a hint of cool air falling out of the ceiling vent. Front desk tells us that a technician will be available in the morning to check it out. Too warm too fall asleep, so we move the bed to under the air vent and we unplug the mini-fridge which is venting plenty of hot air into the room. Following morning we searched out the technician who eventually comes to the room, removed a ceiling panel, reached in , pulled out a small, furry, rectangular inset from air duct, quickly dropped it out of sight inside the ceiling cavity and began to reinstall the ceiling cover. Recognizing the furry rectangle he removed and dropped out of sight as the air filter, I stated that I did not want to sleep in an enclosed room with unfiltered air coming in from the rest of the hotel ducts. He did go off and returned with a relatively clean looking filter. When my wife woke up with half a dozen bug bites in the morning. We stored the cover and a very well worn, fuzzy blanket in the bottom of the bureau drawer for the rest of the nights. Breakfast was in the basement of the hotel. Low ceiling and musty. Very nice white "linen " napkins, white ceramic plates and cups and metal cutlery settings at the tables. Food choices consisted of stale breads, croissants ,etc, instant coffee expresso machine, huge open bowls of yogurt and generally some of the most unappetizing food we had anywhere over a three week period. Had a tiny bit there and got breakfast elsewhere. Very noticeably, much of the food taken by guests were left behind on their plates after they left . Of four desk personnel that we spoke to, one showed a semblance of concern for us as "guests" On the last day we asked if they would phone a cab for us the morning of our departure to the airport and we were told that they would only call their "service car" which was a total of $55 Euros to take us to the airport. We had been quoted $40 E online from a similar service. We decided to walk to a Taxi stand around the corner where we ended up paying $25 E for the trip. Hotel Gambrinus?It left us with a very unclean and creepy feeling. Ruined our overall feeling for Rome. For just a few dollars more, enjoyable places are available .( Two other hotels booked through Hotwire ( London and Barcelona) did turn out to be very satisfactory) Our mistake: didn't check out Trip Advisor ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCI35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gambrinus for two days and woke up with horrible welts on my arms and legs the second day. The other travelers in my party had the same condition. When I returned to the states I went to the doctor and he informed me I was bitten by bed bugs. We called the hotel management and they said they did not receive any complaints and we must have been bitten at our previous location becuase they checked the room and found nothing. I find that highly unlikely considering everyone else in my party experienced the same condition at the exact same time and we all came from different locations. Very disappointed and quite frankly disgusted. The hotel management should really be more concerened that their hotel has a very big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 4 star hotel it is held out to be but overall not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: CLA0406
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire and got a supposed great deal on what was held out on hotwire as a 4 star hotel in a great area of Rome (near the Spanish steps). Two nights were just under $400. We arrived and the room was very good size but the ac did not work. After three calls to the front desk we learned that they keep the temp at a standard temp throughout the hotel and that is 76 (which is a little too warm to me). The hotel advertises that they have highspeed internet in the rooms but this was not working. They have wireless in the lobby but it cuts out a lot. They do have a business center with an Ethernet connection though. They advertise that they have room service but we could never find a menu and our two attempts to call resulted in the phone just ringing and ringing. The staff was very nice and the breakfast that was included was impressive. . The price was not bad but my confidence in hotwire is a bit shaken--- this was for sure not a 4 star hotel. A 3 star at best. But all in all—if the temperature thing wouldn’t bother you (or if you are going a little later on this fall when it’s cooler) this is not a bad hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel if your price is right”
Reviews.Author: MagBlossom
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after using trip advisor. We managed to get the best rate from lastminute.com. from the trip advisor site. The price we paid made the hotel value for money. If you arrive late and need to use a taxi the most you should pay from Termini is around 9 euros, so be warned, we were asked for 15 from one of the "bad" taxis. The hotel is well within a 10 minute walk once you know where you are. The hotel is close to all the sites you travel to Rome to see, with lots of buses on hand to quickly whisk you to Termini, if you intend to walk to further afield. There are enough local restuarants if you return too tired from the day out to want to travel to eat. They are better in the back streets if you have a good look around behind Septtembre XX. The hotel rooms are small, with heavily patterned soft furnishings, but clean and comfortable. We had no hot water early morning, but it was no major issue as it heated up after breakfast! The breakfast was absolutely fine with a hot and cold selection. The only complaint I would have is there was limited lounge facilities, especially as it rained the full week we were in Rome!! The bar area is very small in the basement and lacks atmosphere. The best meal we had was at a restuarant opposite the Opera house, and it was a lot cheaper than some others. I would have been disappointed had I paid some of the higher quotes for the hotel, so ensure you get the best price. Overall it was a good hotel with no major flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonshineLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, located in a reasonable distance from the historical parts of the city, however bus stops are very close to the hotel and can help when you're tired or would rather to spend your time to see more rather than having a 15-20 minutes walk. I'm usually fussy but the room, sheets and bathroom was very clean. Room was a bit small, but reasonable size with european standard. Thich curtains can help you to feel dark like night and keep sleeping if you're still so tired. But sometimes there was a noise from upstairs like pouring the water. I don't know what it was. There's a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel for 8 euro, and also a free bottle of wine, when you book through hotel website. I found it a good value for money 4 star hotel if you want to accommocate in a clean and good place but not paying so much.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mizbDronfield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but extremely clean and well positioned in a quiter part of the city centre heart, no noise, no traffic etc. We were given a good size room with all facilities required. We can not fault this hotel at all which makes its smaller size aminities and bar area are irrelevant. We walked to every where from this wonderfully positioned hotel. Few good restuarants just round the corner from the hotel with nice food and choice (staying late as well, after coming back exploring the beautiful city of Rome so no rush to get out for food). The breakfast is plenty with all what you need before you start your walking. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. We had a great time at this lovely place and will hopefully back to it again. We strongly recommend it. Dr & Mrs Miz

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: johnkaren
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus in September and although the entrance to the hotel is small the feeling you get is that it's like a tardis.....rooms go off in all directions. It wasn't noisy as you are away from the busy area. We got the bus from the airport (they mention this transfer on the flight and it's cheaper than the taxi)and this took us to the main station and we walked to the hotel from there and this took around 10 minutes.Good location, we walked into the main areas of Rome which took about 15 minutes, and the hotel was reasonably priced. The breakfast was ok, a fair choice of different foods. Very clean and the staff were helpful. Good little restaurant around the corner...and doesn't cost city prices. Good for a 4 day City break.

Reviews.Title: “Hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: meregp1
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner does not work, the desk try to tell me that I need to keep the card inserted in the wall, which I already had, and they say they will look at it, they came and open the window, it was bad, air conditioner works with the windows close, everybody knows that. Breakfast was bad, the work coffee in Italy, I went to eat outside

Reviews.Title: “Give It A Try!!”
Reviews.Author: momlovesitaly
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in March and our stay was very enjoyable. The breakfast buffet is very good with a good variety. The rooms are very clean and a bit small, but since we only went to the hotel to sleep we didn't mind. The staff was always friendly and the bellman was extremely helpful. We are going back again in March and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with Gambrinus”
Reviews.Author: Teacher07
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Gambrinus for 3 nights in August. Unlike a previous reviewer, we did not have any problems with our on-line reservation. We even requested an additional cot for 2 nights when my son's friend decided to join us and it was prepared upon our arrival. We also arranged airport shuttle service only a few days prior to our stay through e-mails to Daniela and all worked out fine. The hotel itself has some flaws. We reserved a family room - two adjoining rooms. They were rather small and dark but they each had a washroom and one of them was quite spacious. Also, it was the only hotel on our European trip that provided an ironing board and iron. This was an added convenience. I don't know why more hotels in Italy do not do so. The breakfast room was not comfortable at all - several small rooms - tables were not cleared quickly enough. The food was fine though the coffee was terrible. They should offer cappucino. The elevator was very small and slow - we often took the stairs. The location was fine - an acceptable walk to key sites. The hotel was quiet at night. Overall, we had a decent stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: brendaLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fairly good location, but that is about the only positive. It is not a 4 star, as the rooms were dark and small and the overall feel of the hotel was quite claustrophobic. The lift was tiny, and there is no access to a stairwell - which didn't help when the lift kept getting stuck! The breakfast was mostly tinned or processed food, and the breakfast room was also very dark. Would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gambrinus Hotel for 2 days in May 2007. We were a little concerned given the mixed reviews of the hotel, but overall we were pleased. The rooms ARE small and the showers were very tiny, but those were our only complaints about the hotel itself. We knew this going into our stay, so we were prepared. All the rooms were clean, and the staff was very friendly. The location is not in the heart of Rome, so that was a drawback. But we felt perfectly safe there and overall enjoyed our stay. We didn't have any problems with noise from the street; we could hear our next door neighbors but only when they entered/left their room. If you know these things ahead of time and are looking for a cheaper place, we would definitely recommend the Gambrinus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Expensive Experience”
Reviews.Author: pettchr1
Reviews.Content: I had a perfectly horrible experience at this hotel in 2005. My daughter and I held tickets for a Sunday morning flight from Rome to Venice. We arranged for airport transportation through the front desk. There wasn't another choice, actually, since there was no public phone, etc. We finished breakfast in the dungeon area of the hotel (basement without windows which was extremely hot and uncomfortable in mid summer) in ample time and awaited our transportation in the area that I guess poses as a lobby (so small it hardly qualifies as that in my opinion--this is a 3-4 star hotel???? Also, only one elevator.) The driver arrived and apparently had words with the front desk personnel. My Italian is limited, but I could understand most of it, and it appeared to be a problem of ego. In any case, the driver left in a huff, leaving us stranded and having to catch a flight. As I recall, the transportation was called for at least two hours in advance of our flight time. The front desk man who had engaged in the argument with the first driver promised to deliver another. We waited and waited and waited. Finally, another appeared but unfortunately by the time we arrived at the airport, we had missed our flight. The reservations were a bit flexible, so I wasn't too worried until I found out that the next flight on the airline we were booked on didn't depart for Venice until 5pm (it was 8 am on Sunday morning). Long story short, I had to purchase emergency full fare tickets on Alitalia to the tune of over $700 all because two Italian egos got in the way of our getting to the airport via transportation that I was forced to allow the hotel to arrange and deliver. Never stay at this hotel!! The accomodations and the food suck, too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefano1018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night prior to joining a cruise ship. We were very pleasantly surprised at the room which was much bigger and brighter than expected. The hotel location was minutes walking from Via Veneto , is in a quiet area but ideally situated for exploration and transport. There are several good restaurants close by. We ate at the " Il Viaggio " and the meal was excellent and reasonably priced. Go early if you haven't booked.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a 4-star if a LITTLE out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Hasski
Reviews.Content: In Rome where accomodation is scarce, this 4-star hotel just about lives up to the grading The internal rooms tend to be quite dark so make sure you ask for one on a higher floor if you can't get street-side. Our original room was mall and dark room on the first floor. We insisted on another room and were eventually given a larger one of the 4th floor. With that in mind, it's even more surprising that the bathrrom was SMALL. the shower cube can only be entered sideways and only if you're slim. My wife was pregnant so it was a real challenge. There room is reasonablly equipped. There is a flat screen satellite TV and in-room safe. The staff were friendly enough, though we had to ask for things (like extra pillows) several times before they arrived. The breakfast is quite good - continental as well as British/American, though it seemed understaffed on the days we were there The Gambrinus is located within 15-20min walking distance of Termini, and about 30min from the Spanish Steps. The main shopping areas are about 15-20min walk away. There is a bus stop directly opposite the hotel with buses serving most of central Rome. The nearest metro is Termini. the front desk are also very good at calling a cab which usually arrives in minutes For about £130 a night, it seemed one of the best available. On another occasions, I'd probably spend a little extra for something closer to the centre / higher-grade NB: As you will note from other reviews of Rome hotels on TripAdvisor, hotels have a habit of "forgetting" your booking. We thought an email confirmation guaranteed by credit card was sufficient but were turned away on the night we arrived. They blamed the problem on their computer. We booked Gambrinus through Expedia from an internet cafe..

Reviews.Title: “Dark and damp”
Reviews.Author: ShellsEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 (long) nights at the Hotel Gambrinus and it certainly isn't a hotel I would recommend. We flew to Ciampino Airport and got the Terrorvision coach to Termini Station as the reviews we read said the hotel was near enough to walk from there. Well we agree it is but it certainly wasn't the few minutes/couple of hundred metres we were led to believe. We got to the hotel for eleven but couldn't check in until 2 which was fair enough as this was clear on the booking form. I must admit after seeing the photo's of the hotel and the rooms on Expedia and paying between £134 to £150 per night I was hoping for a bit of Four Star comfort. The reception area although small was clean, and the person on reception always acknowledged you. The lift was a joke as it took so long to come we usually walked the four floors to and from our room. Our room was well, not exactly how it was portrayed in the photo's. It was at the back of the hotel with a tiny view of the back of other people's apartments and was dark all of the time. It was also boiling hot so we were greatful for the air conditioning. The bathroom was small but it also smelt awful, like dirty water and of course there was no window for ventilation. We also had problems with the cleaner who said we had come back to our room too early ( we came back at 4pm after leaving at 8am) and could we go away again for five minutes. Considering it took her five minutes to do and believe me they start very early (our room was next to their sore cupboard) what where they doing? We also had to go to reception to ask for toilet paper. I think we were prepared for breakfast to be a problem from some of the reviews we read but even we couldn't face it on the last day. You are literally squeezed into the packed basement with very little choice of food and with a waiter that shouted in your face. On the one occasion we went to the bar for a drink, the bar was closed. If you even look at the basement area you really wouldn't consider having an evening meal there. The hotel itself is about 15 to 20 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and certainly isn't central. That said there are a few resturants dotted around and the area felt safe to walk in at night. I wish I hadn't experienced this hotel but our opinion of Rome is fantastic. I booked the hotel in January and was guided by other people's reviews so has the hotel changed for the worse since then? This hotel is on the whole very over priced for an out of the way hotel and certainly doesn't even scrape a three star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much To Like”
Reviews.Author: Tanagan
Reviews.Content: Though marketing itself as a 4 star hotel, the Gambrinus, even by Roman standards, barely qualifies for 3. In general, the lack of attention to detail is reflected in the quality of the service, the room and the common areas, bringing the overall experience of staying at this property unpleasant and certainly not worth the over US$230/night we paid. The room was the biggest problem. My objections are not so much with the relatively small size, which is to be expected in any major European centre, but the low quality of the bathroom, bed and amenities. Considering we were expecting a 4 star hotel, the flourescent bedside and bathroom lights were a disappointment and the ugly 70's era furniture also brought down the tone of the room. Though we were promised a 'double' room, the bed was just two twin beds pushed together. I've seen this done before and it wasn't a problem when done properly with a full mattresscover holding the thing together. At the Gambrinus however, the two beds were only kept together by a top sheet, meaning they easily split up leaving an uncomfortable crack down the centre. The bedding itself was of poor quality, with no duvet, but just a rough blanket and bed cover. Only two pillows were provided and they were limp and lumpy. The bathroom lacked a bath and the tiny shower was awkwardly placed so as to only have a 40 cm opening by which one would squeeze in to the cubicle. Moreover, the bathroom lacked a ceiling, instead having an industrial looking black grate covered in dust, through which one could see the piping and other utilities above. Other issues with the room included the lack of a bathroom fan, the lack of a clock and a guest directory that was just a mini bar menu. The thin walls also meant we could hear everything from the next room, whether it be the television, a cough, the door bell or muffled conversation. There were notable problems with the hotel's service as well. Housekeeping simply failed to show up to clean our room one day, and while they met our request for extra pillows promptly, they simply did not answer the phone at all when we ran out of toilet paper. While one day we were frustrated by their inattention, on another we were upset over their zealousness when the maid chose to ignore our do not disturb sign and walked right in to the room. The breakfast staff, while efficient, seemed harried and overworked. An early 11am checkout time, the lack of notice of noisy maintenance repairs and a 20 euro charge to store things in the room minibar also seemed to reflect an inattentiveness to guest comfort. To top it off, the location of the Gambrinus is not exactly in central Rome and requires atleast a 20 minute walk just to get to the edge of the sightseeing district. The neighbourhood is nice from an aesthetic perspective, but being surrounded by embassies and government ministries hardly makes up for the lack of restaurants nor the charm of other central Rome neighbourhoods. This is not to say that the Gambrinus is wholly terrible. The view from our corner room, which came with windows on two sides, was quite nice, and the front desk service was generally quite helpful as well. It is also within a 10 minute walk of Termini station, which is convenient when arriving and departing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Schmog
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient hotel and fine for a short stay.It is just a basic hotel . They have a shuttle for 8 Euro that will pick you up at Fumicino and deliver you to the Hotel. There is a bus stop directly across the street that will take you to the train terminal. It is a bit of a walk ( 15 minutes) to most of the attractions but the hotel staff is friendly and they provide you with a wonderful map. The breakfast was a nice variety of offerings. My room was nice, especially after I poured a little shampoo into the smelly bidet!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doscal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cost effective, does what it says on the tin (with no frills) and has friendly staff. Stay here if you are ok with walking to metro station (which brings you everywhere) - do not stay here if you are bringing kids, elderly folk or are disabled. I had a plesent stay but the breakfast is the same every morning and is brutal!! On my first day I had to go out and buy an italian adaptor for my shaver as the spanish one I had didnt plug into the wall! You pay for what you get and I didnt expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Ot a bad choice”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights in February - first impressions are that Hotel is relatively near the station but not walkable with suitcases. Entrance area is very small and public areas areas are almost non existent. I arrived at 12 noon and any my room wasnt ready but was when returned at about 3.30. Staff are accommodating without being overly freindly. Rooms are adequate with a nice plasma screen but bathrooms are ridicously small - anly large person would struggle with the space availble - my room only offered a shower and looked over the street and which was quite noisy. Internet access is available free in the basement although not all of the computers were working. Breakfast is a mediocre affair and you may be better going out. Location wise the Hotel is in walking distance from places but could not be said that it is centrally located. All in all not a bad choice for the price paid but dont expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Small- out of the way- friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel100
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very small, as expected. The bathroom ceiling was not "finished", and we had major difficulty with the toilet. I would ask for a garden room if possible it did get a bit noisy at night. The staff was extremely helpful and very accommodating. If you are not worried about being out of the center of Rome and want to save a few dollars then this is a good hotel for you. I would have preferred to pay a little more to be closer to the action. I didn't realize it was quite so far out of the way. I read some reviews about walking to major sites like the Coloseum. That really isn't realistic. My suggestion would be to take a cab to your destination then work your way around to your desired sites then possibly hop on the 110 bus tour and get dropped off at Termini train station and walk back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tiresias
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at the hotel - nothing really terrible but generally disappointing. The hotel's website is downright untruthful - It is NOT a 4* hotel as its website proclaims - the notices in its bedrooms admit that it is a 3*. It is not in a "quiet quarter" - it fronts directly onto a busy bus route. It is not "a few yards from the Via Veneto" - it is half a mile. Rooms and showers too small, breakfasts disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: aussiegreg
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here and found the front desk staff some of the friendliest and helpful people around italy, there went out of there way to get us around and explain stuff,the location is great for the bus, there a stop right outside which goes to the central station. and another down the street that goes to the vatican, there was some street noise but not to much, the room was very clean and tide with plenty of space, the shower was a tad small for me (im 6'1 and 95kg), its a very easy walk to most of the big attractions if you have the shoes and the time. all in all a top place to stay. the breakfast was very filling, lots of meats, breads, cereal, fruit and yogurt. more than enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: EdAl
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel in a nice area of Rome, friendly and helpful staff. They kept our luggage until we could check in and after we had to check out. The breakfasts are substantial and with varied food to cater for all tastes. The location is good, only a 5 minute bus ride from the Termini (where most bus routes depart) and walking distance to some of the famous sights. Buy a bus pass from the tobacconist, well worth using to save your legs! A good selection of restaurants/cafes within walking distance - if you come across one called The Boulevard Wine Bar (doesn't sound Italian and I have no idea of the road name) it serves wonderful traditional food, hardly any English spoken and a menu you won't understand but be brave! The rooms were extremely clean but on the small side, especially the bathroom and the shower - not for large people! The only negatives were the air conditioning which was noisy and the room got very hot even in October so be aware of this. Our room, 412, was next to the lift and the noise of the braking mechanism did disturb us. The breakfast room was cramped and window-less so it got quite hot and claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fourth_Monkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gambrinus for 3 nights so I could do some serious sightseeing in Rome. Location: The hotel is situated just north of the town centre, there is a bus stop right opposite the hotel, and 3 different buses take you to the Termini, where you can get the Metro or loads of other buses to the sights. I brought a 3 day ticket from the tobacconist, which you can use on all the public transport. Just remember to put the ticket in the small yellow machines on the bus each time you get on. Most of the buses have LCD screens letting you know what the next stop is. You can walk to most places and I walked from the Termini to the hotel with all my baggage on the 1st day and it took around 15 mins. There are various bars and restaurants in the area if you walk round the streets. Hotel: As previously mentioned in reviews the rooms are small, but ok if you, like I, just wanted a base. The staff were great, all spoke great English, and will give you a good tourist map when you check in. The bed was comfortable. The room was very clean, and the room was serviced well. Nice towels. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, I took a small travel kettle and adapter which worked fine. The shower is small but effective. There are four floors to the hotel but only one small lift, at breakfast you may have to wait your turn for it. Breakfast was fine, but the restaurant area small and I had to wait for a table twice. My room did not have a view, and was situated near the lift so was noisy when the lift was being used, it did not disturb me during the night. The room does have a TV in there, but choice of channels are limited. The AC wasn't brilliant, and i was glad I wasn't there in August. The bar isn't cheap and very quiet. I would recommend the hotel, it certainly served my purpose, and Rome was fantastic. I enjoyed the sights sounds and people. Be a little wary on the buses and Metro, there are pickpockets and beggars were everywhere. Also south of the Termini is a bit rough, stay away after dark. A tip for sightseeing would be hire a guide for the colleseum, forum and palantine, only costs an extra 10 euros and it brought them all to life, For the vatican go around 3pm, as earlier the queues were around 2-3 hours long. Have a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: sophiesmitsadams
Reviews.Content: The Gambrinus Hotel was a lovely surprise - the room was nice and the staff were pleasant. The only disappointing aspects were the fact that is was so far out of the way, so ended up getting taxis to many sights. Also we found the "breakfast room" rather disappointing, as the tables were all rather close together and felt that we had to climb over other people to go and get our buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikym
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here in August. Hotel was clean, breakfast was nice, the rooms were good size for Europe and clean . It's a bit of a walk from the train station-I recommend a taxi, but its location is perfect for seeing all of the sights. Beds One side of the hotel is located on a busy street hence some road noise-maybe request a room not on the river side. The staff was ok and realy friendly maybe a bit disdainful, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trivella
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on Trip Advisor, but my experience of Hotel Gambrinus was so good My parents and I spent 4 nights in room 312, a triple. Every detail was taken care of: lovely decoration, good, hard beds, and a very good AC. Actually the AC was crucial, with all the heat at the end of July.Riccardo and the other staff members were very helpful--they gave advice and directions and always had a smile on their face. This is my third trip to Italy and I never had such good breakfast before. To answer the concern of some previous posters who didn't think much of the breakfast: the traditional Italian fare in the morning is a croissant, bread and jam. Therefore, the buffet breakfast at Gambrinus really stands out. Despite the heat wave in Europe at the end of July, we did not find the location of the hotel in the Oltrarno to be a problem: we enjoyed the 15-minute walk to Spanish Steps in the morning and back late at night. I've stayed in hotels in some Italian cities, but this was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived from LDV airport only to find out the floors had been flooded and we had to move to another hotel way across the city. They paid for the cab ride and the new hotel was nice, but in a very quiet neighboorhood. Probably would have enjoyed it more if we spoke any Italian. Was somewhat disappointed that we had to move.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: caplet
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early February with a friend. Booked a twin room, however room was so small that beds were almost touching. However saying that room was very clean and compact although could hear other guests due to the wooden floors in the rooms. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast was ok set in the dining room / bar in the cellar a bit dingy due to the lack of natural light. Check out the Italian restaurant across the road (can't remember the name) lovely food at very reasonable prices. Don't bother paying for a taxi if you are coming from Terminus train/bus station as only 10 minute walk unless you have lots of luggage. On the map this doesn't look the most central hotel however most of the sights are accessable on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but HORRIBLE beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: usangel
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome - really studied and went thru all the reviews of affordable hotels before we settled on Hotel Gambrinus. Decent enough location, within walking distance to many main attractions. The photo submitted with the hotel is very deceiving - it appears to be a large hotel front - when in fact, its a tiny doorway from the street, our driver passed it a few times before we found it. We expected the tiny rooms but NOT the horrible bed. It was hard as a rock with springs coming thru in spots. When we complained and asked for another room, we were basically told all the beds were the same. My husband and I never got a decent's nights sleep, tossed and turned all night long. Plus we did have a few bugs in the bathroom - but after killing them, we didn't see them again. Wouldn't really recommend the hotel, there's got to be nicer ones for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for your stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaProvidence
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gambrinus is very well located. It's about a 10 minute walk from the Termini and the Piazza Republica train stations in a very safe neihborhood near La Rinescente, the Italian Macy's. The hotel room was very pretty and clean. The staff was very knowledable about Rome and was helpful. The breakfast buffet is excellent too. So far, it is the best hotel we stayed at during a 9-day trip in Italy. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Rome. Stayed at the Hotel Gambrinus. Had booked a Standard Double Room thru Travelocity. When we arrived they had us booked for a Single Room. After a 10 hour flight, an arrival at a dirty airport, having to hunt down the "transfer company" (also booked thru Travelocity), I was in no mood to deal with problems. The clerk at Gambrinus said "Here's a map, come back in 4 hours." We left and returned in 2 hours when we were given 2 single rooms...both dark, old and noisey. The breakfast was ok but nothing great. Next time I'm in Rome, I'll stay in the Barberini area...closer to Via Veneto. Liked the Roman ruins and the Vatican but found Rome to be dirty and most people rude. I live in a tourist town and know the value of treating visitors with courtesy... something Romans need to learn!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookie376
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Gambrinus in Nov for 2 nights. We took the terrivision bus from the airport to the termini station then grabbed a taxi which cost 4 euros. Arrived at the hotel and what a welcome really helpful. The room was fab very well furnished and clean. Breakfast was average all cold except for scrambled eggs and toast, but a wide varity of cakes, meats and juices, coffee was good the breakfast area small but caused no problems. The trevi fountain is a 10min walk away and lots of restaurants and bars in area. We ate in a very romantic area next to Trevi cost 70 euros for 3 courses and two bottles of wine, expected it to cost more. Beware of the people handed you flowers they are pushy but a stern no will see them off, watch cameras and wallets in this area. Caught metro to vatican spend at least a full day here and was easy to find and interesting got to see the papal mass which was good. The bus system fairly simple and hotel staff very helpful and provide a detailed map on arrival. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. For value, location and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, superb satff and location”
Reviews.Author: LemanandAngieHarris
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gambrinus was a pleasure to say in - we have just returned back to the UK having enjoyed 2 nights there. Superb pre-booking through Expedia (£149 for 2 nights bed & breakfast). Breakfast will suit all palates - hot food as well as fresh fruit, cereals, juices, yoghurts and drinks. Surprised that the orange juice seemed diluted as walking down the streets in Rome you can clearly see fresh oranges growing on the trees!! This would never happen in Florida now would it? Staff were very courteous and well versed in English. I e-mailed the hotel a week before our departure to get local information and had by immediate return an incredible amount of useful information on tours, local sites & recommendations - superb. Try the restaurant across the road from the hotel - delicious local food at very reasonable prices - most enjoyable. Rooms smaller than the average double room but very comfortable and clean. Shower cubicle the smallest I've seen (I kept accidently turning the water off with my back!) - minibar available in rooms, although satellite tv only provided BBC World News - no other English speaking Channels, except for the chargeable Movie Channels. All in all, highly recommended. Do not be put off by other negative reviews on this site - make your own opinion like we did. Walk to the Trevi Fountain no more than 15 minutes ... and don't forget - Vatican City, the Vatican Museums & the Sistine Chapel are all FREE entrance on the last Sunday of every month! How lucky were we?!! Stunning!! Pure opulence! Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Checco
Reviews.Content: stayed there many times for work. your experience on this hotel strongly depends on the room you get. new rooms are nice, Old ones are very bad. All of them are very small. Excellent Location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service and Extremely Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mum always wanted to visit Rome so we booked for the first weekend in November. After looking at so many hotels and not knowing exactly where they were we found the Hotel Gambrinus within our budget. We stayed for 3 nights. I had e-mailed the hotel ahead of arrival asking about transfer from airport. They were extremely helpful and booked this for us at a discounted rate of 4 Euro each. When we arrived and checked in I asked them about the return trip to airport they said this would be more expensive (58 Euro for both of us) which we were happy about as they explained that they subsidised the inward journey. The hotel, check-in was great and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They explained on a map where everything was and how to get around and gave us information about trips using the Green Line Tours. Because we were only there for 2 full days and flying back out on the morning of the 3rd day we decided to book trips to ensure we made the most of stay. We booked 3 half day trips: Trip 1 - was partly walking, we got dropped off at the Trevi Fountain and it took us through to the Pantheon and the bus then picked us back up and took us to St Peter's Square we were able to go in and look around. Trip 2 - took us to the historic centre, the forum, capital hill and St Paul's Basilica and then on to the Coliseum. Trip 3 - took us straight to the Sistine Chapel and we had to queue for an hour and a half before getting in and I believe that was quite short its hours longer in the summer/peak times. The tour guides were great, especially Massimo who was very passionate about the Sistine Chapel and the bus picked you up from your hotel and dropped you back off wherever you wanted. On our last day we were dropped off at the Spanish Steps and we walked back to the hotel from there it was only about a 3 minute stroll. Not long at all. The breakfast in the hotel was great, just what you needed, plenty to choose from. The rooms, we opted for a superior room which was decorated to a very high standard although we were in a room that had an adjoining door to the next room and my mum got a bit of a fright on the nights as the neighbours were making a bit of noise and she thought they were going to get in. The pizzeria across the straight was fantastic and not at all expensive 30 Euro for starters, main courses, wine and water for 2 people. The receptionist at the hotel did recommend a restaurant a couple of streets away which was a traditional restaurant. You weren't given any menus you just went in sat down they gave you wine, water and then started coming with different courses, mozzarella, ricotta cheese, salami, antipasti etc. then a pasta dish and then even more they came with a roasted pork dish with potatoes etc. Then desert. We almost rolled out of there. It was a bit more expensive 40 Euro each but well worth the experience. Up the street from the hotel there were some boutiques and a department store called la Rinascente where we did some shopping which was great and the store was open until 10 pm every night - fantastic! So all in all I would highly recommend this hotel and the trip to Rome is well worth the visit, I hope to return in the future and I suspect I'll stay in the same hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TallTexan82
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a vacation to Italy that included a 3 day stay at the Hotel Gambrinus (*please note that the picture on the main page is of an entirely different hotel). The Hotel Gambrinus is a charming, unique hotel that is a little north of historic rome, but not more than a 15 minute walk. We paid around $100 US for a small (by American standards - but very much in line with the rest of Europe), tastefully decorated room with 2 twin beds and very tall ceilings. The free breakfast was extensive and served in the basement with a beautiful cathedral ceiling. The free internet was a nice touch and easily saved me 10 euros worth of charges in Rome. Overall, I enjoyed the Hotel Gambrinus, and, with many rooms in Rome going for over $200 US, I felt like a I received a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Average Service, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in Rome with my girlfriend and that was way too short a visit to see what this great city has to offer. I booked my room through Travelocity and we are two single females, so I reserved two single beds, we got a joined king instead upon check-in. The concierge was not very friendly initially, but did agree to separate the beds the following day since housekeeping had already left for the day. He did indeed follow-up on that and we had our two single beds. He also warmed up a little bid later on and gave us some good restaurant recommendations. The best thing about this hotel is the location, the rooms are very tiny for two people, but I've also been in smaller rooms. I have to give this hotel an average rating for a four star, it's a good three star, nothing really special about it at all, other than its five minutes by taxi from Termini, but 45 minutes from the airport. So, if you don't spend lots of time in the hotel, (and why would you with so much to see and do), and you want to be close to the train station book this hotel, if you get a good deal. If you are seeking superior customer service or large rooms, go some place else. They did have internet access, but it doesn't open until 11 am, but it was free which was nice, only one computer was working at the time. The b-fast was slightly above avg, they had some cold meats, bread, OJ, coffee, eggs (only hotel we stayed at w/ eggs), the eggs were a little funny, but we like them. Overall, I would probably stay somewhere else; I'm dying to try the Metropole hotel in Rome upon my next visit. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Did a favor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE had just had gotten to the hotel after a long flight and a very warm day. I just walked into the front door and was greeted by someone at the front desk.As soon as I said my name...They had told me that there was a problem with the a/c. They had moved me to another hotel ( The Bailey Hotel ) which was a few blocks away. We had to walk with our luggage. I had spoken to the Mgr of Baileys and they said they do this alot. They overbook. I am glad that we stayed at the Bailey hotel because they were great. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was good. They had eggs! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: NM3
Reviews.Content: Gambrinus Hotel was a great find. It was brilliant value for money and only 10 min walk from Termini station. The staff were extremely proffessional, helpful and friendly and were always happy to offer us assistance when needed. As well as being given a map and info on public transport services from the hotel, we were even given a Gambrinus tourist book on Rome for free, which was very useful and a great touch, so need to buy a travel book on Rome if you stay here ! Although the Official Hotel website states that it is a 4 Star hotel, me and my partner really felt it was at 3 star-level. We asked for recommendations of places to eat on both nights, as the restaurant was closed for a week during our stay. On one of our evenings there, we went to a great, traditional Italian restaurant. I believe it is called Alzurri, 5 mins walk from the hotel. This restaurant is a definate MUST. It was brilliant. Be prepared for a feast.

Reviews.Title: “Rome a great City to visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Watch taxi charges we arrived late from airport to Termini Station that is not more than a 10 min walk from the hotel and the taxi charged us 40 euros and also drove like a maniac. This was an official white taxi so be warned. Hotel room small, curtain would not close and bathroom smelt a little especially in the morning. The shower cubicle was very small and the opening also small so if you are bigger than average be prepared to shower at bit of your body at a time. The lift is small so you may have to wait a while if too many want to go on it. Otherwise OK and breakfast was reasonable although the tables were so small you could hardly fit the plates on. The hotel was adequate for our stay and was a safe haven after many hours of walking and travelling round the city. The air conditioning worked well. One tip, we took a day trip by train to Pisa from Termini to see the leaning tower from Termini station 82.94 euros for 2 adults return. Well worth a vist but over a 3 hour train journey but a great journey along the Italian coastline and with ordinary Italian people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monicamum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at Hotel Gambrinus and thought it was a great hotel and excellent value. On arrival we were given a map of Rome (wish I knew that before I spent money on a map in the UK). The map is now very well worn having used it all day every day. The room we had was a family room having two teenagers with us, it was very clean and the two bathrooms we had were clean and full of supplies, eg Dove soap, shower gel and two hairdryers a plus with a fifteen year old daughter. The room could be shut off by a connecting door. The staff at the hotal were just great. On the first night we had been up very early that morning and went to bed about 10.30 p.m. we could still hear the music in the corridor my husband phoned down to reception and asked them to turn it down it was turned off immediately. Also we put a blanket under our one pillow and when we arrived back later that day the maid had put us extra pillows on our bed. The breakfast was very good, if anything can fill my eighteen year old son it must be good. Overall I couldn't fault this hotel, the staff, rooms, location everything was above average and I must say having read some negative reviews AFTER I had booked I had mixed feelings. I would definitely return to the Gambrinus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surpise”
Reviews.Author: advgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Gambrinus for one night in July of 2005. It was a wonderful treat at the end of our trip to Italy. The hotel was the best that we visited in Italy in both price and appearance. We paid $110 euros for our room and that price included breakfast. This price was booked via the hotel's website just one day prior to arrival. The staff were kind and helpful. We asked for a "nice room" and were given room #202. The elevator took us up to our floor-yes, I did say elevator. The room had beautiful fabric walls and wood floors. It was a spacious room! There were several nice additions, such as bathtub, Dove soap, and "real" hairdryer. Believe me, these additions are hard to find for this price in Italy. The breakfast was served American style-eggs, cereal, fruit. It was filling and delicious. They have a great deal if you are arriving at Leonardo Da Vinci airport. The hotel will pick you up from the airport and take you to their hotel for $5 euros. The return drive to the airport is considerably more though. The only disadvantage to the Hotel Cambrinus is that it is located slightly outside of some of the major attractions. There is a bus stop just outside of the hotel. If you are able to walk, this should be no problem for you. We loved this hotel! We will absolutely stay here when in Rome again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great welcome”
Reviews.Author: anmc
Reviews.Content: What a friendly, courteous and helpful welcome at the Gambrinus Hotel! Arriving late after a stressful flight we got such a genuine welcome from the night clerk at reception. The hotel was very well placed for our 4 day trip and we found the breakfast good and the room comfortable. Eat at the local Anni something or other in nearby Via Flavia and buy your bus tickets at the Tabac round the corner from the hotel. Well situated for bus routes. Rome is amazing and our coins in the Trevi fountain will guarantee a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - No problems at all.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First up - don’t believe all the negative things on here about this hotel. Every hotel can have its bad days and in most cases people seem to be moaning that the rooms were too small - In an old city like Rome, many hotels are converted from private apartments etc so the rooms aren’t going to be that big. I’ve stayed in room in the UL round London that have been way smaller, not as nice and more expensive However, out room, 102, was perfect - it was a standard double room. We had no ants, no missing fixtures or fittings, the TV worked fine and reception was good (What a nice surprise it was to be able to watch the BBC world service channel). The room was clean and tidy, nicely decorated and arranged - a large bed and a large leather armchair. The bathroom was smallish, but large enough - what are you gonna do in there exactly?!?! Staff were courteous and helpful - they marked out anything we were looking for on their complimentary map. They recommended the wine & grill restaurant near the trevi fountain and it was fabulous. The hotel is not completely central - being quite far from the Vatican etc (10 euro taxi ride), however its very close to the termini station and the Spanish steps (15 mins walk each) and reasonably close to the forum and coliseum area (About 8 euros in a taxi).
