If you want a really central hotel check out the hotel white - that was next to the trevi fountain and looked great. The only real gripe I could have about the hotel was its own bar & restaurant. While it was clean and beautiful with its vaulted ceilings and cool beer, they aren’t making the most of it with their menu and food, which was average. However given that they seemed able to recommend half a dozen places to eat locally and in the centre, and mark them on their map I don’t see this as too much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! I had such a wonderful stay at Hotel Gambrinus The conceirge team was absolutely wonderful and extremely helpful in helping you plan out your days. They are very friendly . Its a beatiful hotel, very clean, and it makes you feel like you are really in Italy.The rooms we stayed in were spacious, clean, and very well air conditioned. The hotel is extremely close to the main tourist attractions. They have a breakfast every morning and they make it wonderful.. Also, even though the hotel is close to the city center, it is very quiet inside which makes it a good place after walking around the city all day. You will definitely feel like you are on vacation in paradise. The next time that I go to Rome , I want will go back at Hotel Gambrinus.

Reviews.Title: “Gambrinus is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: mrskmirolla
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was wonderful and we were delighted with our room. We were told horror stories and this was not one of them. We stayed from June 8 through June 11, 2005. The breakfast in the morning was always warm and plentiful, the rooms were kept immaculate and we would recommend this hotel to everyone! The staff at the desk were extremely helpful. We were close to transportation and could walk everywhere. We walked to the Vatican, the Coloseum, train station, resturants, just everywhere. Never needed a taxi. The hotel map was the greatest it made getting around very simple. If we go back to Rome you can bet we will stay at the Hotel Gambrinus!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zarek
Reviews.Content: All in all this hotel was a pretty reasonable place to stay. The location is not central and it is around 20 minutes walk to any of the tourist areas, ie only a short walk if you enjoy walking, which we did. It is on a bus route with a frequent service to Termini. What were the best things ? Our room overlooked the back of the hotel and a leafy courtyard which gave a real countryside feel which was very pleasant and not at all what you would expect from the front entrance. Breakfast was generous with many interesting things to chose from. The free internet access after 11am is a nice thought although we had problems making it work. The staff, although not overly friendly, where very efficient and helpful. The air conditioning chill in the lobby was lovely when we returned from walking during the day. In the room it appeared to struggle a bit but the temperature did creep down and we were comfortable at night. Any downside ? The room and bathroom were certainly adequate, but possibly a little cramped and boring. For what we paid I was hoping for just a little bit more. It is this that would probably make me try somewhere else next time rather than return here even thought there is a fair risk I might not be as satisfied. Overall Hotel Gambrinus would be a very safe choice for a short holiday break.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful!”
Reviews.Author: luckyjudy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay and were very pleased with all aspects. The hotel arranged a limo to pick us up from the cruise port at a reasonable price. Because we arrived before 2 they looked after our luggage and then assisted us up to our rooms. Our room was a good size with a safe and air-conditioning. It was very clean. It has a bar and a restaurant and free internet from 11am. Breakfast is included and substantial by eoropean standards. The staff was very helpul and made sure we had a limo big enough to take 4 of us plus cruise luggage to the airport. they helped us with phone calls too. They also advised about good restaurants nearby--and we enjoyed them. We would definitely stay there again. Although it isn't right in the centre, it was comforting to know that all the employees were so helpful and friendly and that we could communicate in English. Our Italian is not sufficient, I'm afraid

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mimo36
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary because of other reviews but the Hotel was very nice as was the room, a bit smaller than expected but we managed comforatbly. The shower was also very small, I'm 5'2" and my elbows hit the walls in the shower several times. I would imagine the shower would be very tight for a larger person. The breakfast was very good. The hotel was not close to the sights, with the exception of the Borghese Gallery, so walking got a bit tiring. Over all our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: daphnebigelow
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were average size, maybe a bit bigger than what you usually see in an Italian boutique hotel. The breakfast was top notch with meats, cheese, eggs, cereals, and sweets. The picture of the hotel on this site is not what the hotel looks like-not sure why, but to see an accurate picture check one of the other hotel websites. The location is not as close to the Spanish steps as mentioned-in fact it is NOT within walking distance. The hotel is close to the termini and the bus stops right across the street which allows for easy access to all the sites provided you are willing to take public transportation - it is not within walking distance to anything! I wish the staff would have been more friendly and helpful- I would have then rated the hotel excellent. They provided answers to questions, but did nothing extra to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Malts
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a Superior room and glad we did. Room was very clean, average size but small dark bathroom. No view out of the bedroom window, looked onto another building. Free bottle of red wine was a nice gesture! Breakfast was nice, although room is a bit squashed and bar has no atmosphere. Gambrinus is situated within easy walking distance of most of the attractions in rome and has some nice restaurants around it. We didnt venture far on an evening, walked so much during the day that a stagger to the local bar or restaurant was enough!!! Downside to hotel was the lack of stairs and only 1 lift in the whole building!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean room with a very large nice bathroom with a big tub, which was great afor soaking after long days of walking everywhere. Free breakfast was actually very good. The free ride to the hotel from the airport was disappointing. Our plane got in late, and when my husband called to find out where our car was, the hotel said that they had left and will not return to pick us up. We weren't too happy about that, and ended up having to get a cab to the hotel. Many conveniences around the hotel, little bakeries and cafes. Very quaint. Next time I'd stay closer to the spanish steps as it is quite hike to get there from this hotel, but all in all I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff and Excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying at the Gambrinus for 3 nights. I have to admit that after reading some reviews I had somewhat low expectations. Overall, we are very happy with our stay and didn't experience any problems. I think the staff was very friendly, always greeting, smiling and willing to help. Our room was clean and nice and for Europe standards it was not that small. The breakfast was excellent, a lot of variety, and they even have scrambled eggs. They also have 2 computers in the bar area and offer free internet access, which we found to be very convenient. The hotel location is good, near bus stops and short walking distance to some attractions. I highly recommend taking buses, the bus system in Rome is very efficient. All buses that go to Porta Pia and XX Septembre are nearby the hotel. If one night you don't feel like walking or going too far, the restaurant across the street is not bad and the prices are very reasonable. I think this hotel is a great deal for the money. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Problems upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: CariStroudsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: Our first room was infested with ants in the bathroom. This is an obvious problem to hotel staff, as we saw a can of ant spray in the housekeeping cart. Since we checked in on a Saturday, the only available room was much smaller. We took it, choosing cleanliness over convenience, only to be distrubed until 12:00 midnight by a family living in an apartment directly above this room. Apparently the hotel does not own the entire buidling. After waiting 2 days for another room to become available, we were switched to a much nicer room, although we frequently heard a young child practicing piano, as once again, there was an apartment above our room. The piano was much more appealing then the sound of of a family with children running and yelling and singing and banging constantly. The only bright spot during our stay is the level of care provided to us by Christina, the night front desk clerk. All other staff did not care about our inconveniences or annoyances. Also it's good to note that the airport shuttle advertised is ONLY one way FROM the airport to the hotel. A trip from the hotel to the airport by taxi is 49 euros, otherwise you must take a bus to Termini and then a train to the airport. Also, we paid an additional $2.28 per person per day for a breakfast that was already included with each room purchase. We did bring this to Expedia's attention. Internet service is provided but only available after 11:00am. Last annoyance - the hotel charges 20 euros per day to put your own drinks inside the minibar. Tip on Dining - If you have 3 hours, are hungry and want an experience, dine at Piccolo Abruzzo, just a 5 minute walk from the Gambrinus. It costs roughly 50 euros per person but well worth the money. All the wine, water and food you could ever want. Great restaurant, atmosphere, food and experience. Address is Premio Forchetta d'Oro 83-84. All in all, we would not stay here again. There are enough hotels in Rome, at the same price that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great start to our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What promised to be a great weekend in Rome didn't begin well as when we arrived we were told that our room was unavailable. We were then told (not asked) to move to a different hotel around the corner. Upon arriving here we found it under under construction and smelling of mould and smoke (Hotel Medici) which was not suitable. After an hour of negotiation with the Gambrinus staff we finally compromised on another local hotel for the night. In the morning we moved back, however recieved no apology! Not withstanding this, once we were settled, the hotel was comfortable and the breakfast good. The hotel is also within walking distance (long walk) to most of the interesting sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at the Gambrinus and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We paid 54 UK pounds per night through Expedia. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, the very friendly staff put our luggage in the safe room, gave us a free Rome map, and showed us where to get buses for the major sights (bus stops a short 2 minute walk away). Upon our return we got shown to our room, which was spotlessly clean. Room size was perfectly adequate and well equipped, with iron and board, TV, hairdryer, and a free bottle of wine which was a nice touch. The hotel is located in Rome's commercial district, it's a ten minute walk from Termini, and the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are approx 15/20 mins walk. As I mentioned, buses to all the major sights are within a short distance, and the hotel will advise you on which bus to catch for which stops. Rome's attractions are relatively spread out anyway, therefore even if you booked a hotel near the Colossuem, you'd need transport or a good walk to get to the Trevi, for example. I'd agree with other reviewers that this is a good 3 star and not 4, however it's miles away from your average European 2 star, and I'd thoroughly recommend a stay at the Gambrinus.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on two separate occasions and each time was very satisfied. Cristina and her staff are wonderful and will do whatever they can to make your stay pleasant. This is an authentic European hotel so things will be different, but most enjoyable. English is spoken by everyone which can be a real plus for visitors. The e Metro is just steps away. Whatever minor faults this hotel has is more than compensated for by the genuine hospitality and ambience of it. I will always stay here when I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After the great pictures (on Expedia) it was not what we expected. The rooms were very small. You could just walk around the bed. Bathroom was not very clean. TV was small and had a not very clear reception. One small towel and one bigger towel in a two person room! Absolutely no value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think what turned my wife on when we arrived after a train ride down from Bolzano was the free internet access. The staff were very friendly and a very nice breakfast was included in the in the price Very clean & comfortable. In the morning, they serve breakfast, which is included, which has yogurt, rolls w/cheese & ham, eggs, juice, coffee, tea, fruit, croissants, etc .You are within walking distance of most of the interesting sites. On check out we needed a taxi and they had one arrive within 2 minutes and was waiting for us downstairs when we went out the door. Overall, I'd highly recommend it, it was super .

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really friendly hotel, excellent location for a weekend in Rome. The hotel is less grand than would appear on most websites and the rooms are pretty small but luxuriously decorated and appointed. Having stayed in hundreds of hotels I would rate the Gambrinus as a 3 star. The bar isn't often open and the breakfast is a bit repetitive. HOWEVER - I WOULD stay there again. Because of the staff - they were lovely, helpful, friendly and happy. If you want a quiet weekend away you could do far worse than this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at this recently renovated hotel . The place is run by very friendly and helpful people who speak English very well. Room size was small but is’t average by European standards it was very clean and well appointed. By far the best place we stayed while in Europe for 3 weeks, sadly it was the first stop. The breakfast was also worht mentioning. The best we had for inclusive packages. The staff was great and I'd echo the museum access. We had a great time in Italy and especially Rome -- This as a great stop on our trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “ghastly”
Reviews.Author: boethius
Reviews.Content: The grubby mat at the entrance says it all. This is a two star hotel claiming to be a four star. Tiny rooms and a shower room smaller than one I had on a sailing boat. Breakfast is "organised" by incompetent and rude staff and has to one of the poorest meals ever. Three messages left for us were not passed on. One receptionist tried her best but it did not compensate for the experience. The porter watched with interest as we loaded the taxi on leaving, but made no effort to help. Trip advisor should remove this hotel from its list.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was an adequate size and was very clean. There was a good selection for breakfast (fruit, cereal, breads, ham, cheese etc) and everything was fresh. The hotel is in a quiet area and you can walk to the main train/bus/metro station (Termini) in about 10 minutes where you can get to anywhere you need to go. You can also walk to the Trevi fountain in about 20 minutes. There are some really good reasonably priced restaurants and cafe bars in the area of the hotel. We would recommend taking the 4 euro shuttle bus from the airport directly to the hotel as it is really handy and is also good entertainment value watching the Italians drive!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Gambrinus at the end of our stay in Italy. After having stayed in some really nice places, we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was inexpensive in comparison to similar hotels, it is clean, the rooms are not as small as we had imagined, the location was perfect, it was quiet, and the staff was very courteous and friendly, something you don't always find in Europe. And everyone spoke English. We would definitely recommend this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Gambrinus Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Piave 35, 00187 Rome, Italy
